rOS2PgCbIX5zc2-Epm7HgQ.text: Never received our appetizer.. My fiance and I both sat with empty beers for over 10 minutes.. Very poor service. If you're not a regular here you don't seem to receive quality service

0I2TDElNQiZDo3S-ofJBFA.text: We had an awesome time last night at DNG! Went to hear one of our favorite bands, Small Time Joe, and they ROCKED IT ! It's just a shame that they decided to stuff the band downstairs where it was a 90 degree hot box! We would have stayed longer if we hadn't felt ourselves melting! Food was delicious and the service was great once the servers found us out in the random unairconditioned hallway! Will definitely think twice about going next time if the band plays in the hotbox!

XjM0R3S5tOxxLT8FoCXPvQ.text: My husband and I go to DNG every time we visit Charlotte. We love the atmosphere and this past time had the pleasure to be served by Tracy at the bar. She is very attentive and makes you feel like part of the neighborhood. She suggested we try some appetizers and we got the pizza rolls. They were delicious. We had such a great time and Tracy clinched us coming back again in the near future.

w5nutbPdWpJrWo9ggMSSnQ.text: Very disappointed in the food and service. Pretzel with cheese dip: Vegetarians beware. There is bacon in the dip not noted on menu. Spiedi sandwich: No sauce, just meat and bread. Meat flavored okay, but sandwich lacks. Homemade chips good, but sauce is thinned down ranch dressing. Onion straws very good, fish tacos good. Major problem is service. Understaffed? Don't know but it took 15 mins for server to even come near us and we had to grab her attention to ask for drinks. She complied but acted unwilling at first and took her time reappearing and seemed distracted all night. Won't return.

7yFtcIIyUg5rnTXlQmj0oQ.text: Cool spot that's been around a while and even though it's changed names it's always a great spot to catch the game or just catch up with your friends.  The staff here has always been very accomodating and while the bar area can get packed quick there is plenty of seating towards the back.    The decor is pretty much typical sports bar and I think this is a West Virignia University loyal bar too (for those that care) as well as UNC - Tarheels.  The downstairs is also a good spot for a business meeting or social event.  I've been to a few there and it's nice and roomy.    I've only tried food there a couple times and never had a bad experience but mostly a fan of their deli wraps.  Can't really screw that up though.    One other nice thing is that this bar is one that is pretty well intertwined into the social media scene and has regular 'tweetups' for twitter followers that want to socialize....cool :)

wZ3Y_v_JXZb5aLEZHM5bhA.text: Stopped there today and started with the bruschetta and the toast was stale and hard, very unhappy. My wife had the chicken spedie and the bread wasn't toasted as normal. Too many other places to eat, not going back anytime soon.

vSZruhcU9C9wBgNo1VJ1Bw.text: My wife and I walked into the outdoor area. A waitress smiled at us.  We sat there for 10 minutes. Several employees walked by us. No one ever said a word to us.  We felt invisible..  We got up and left.  I told the manager how we were treated.  Very poor service

eu4hE9z1-UPq1nFJdHO5BA.text: Best for watching games, since the food is just fair. I like a good turkey burger, but this one is not good. Parking can be difficult here, but aside from M-F 9-5, you can find parking in nearby lots/streets.

0F0SGNE1_9NWk7u5QB0XPQ.text: This is my first review . I came in here today with my grandma for a late mothers day gift . The good news was the cobb salad was great .. Defitnitely worth your money . But the bad news was our waitress ignored the heck out of us .. And gave everyone else her attention . She dropped the food off after waiting 40mins for "salads" ! Then after that she never came back to check our drinks or to ask if everything was okay. Worst customer service and ive only been once and it was the worst impression on my grandmother for bringing her here ! This is ridiculous !

_769eA0kNRfPaS3KP5dsyA.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Great on Saturdays kicking back on the patio with $5 mason jar drink specials.

RL_aISFA_VixPFj5aAF0OA.text: I've eaten at this place numerous times over the years- the city police seem to love it so that tells you something right there.   Decent food and decent service. Parking can be a bit tricky.

g4kftDOgnvYy7SrQAXdEpQ.text: The service was outstanding! It would be hard to find more attentive and friendly staff! Typical bar food but felt compelled to give a positive review to Andrew. He was incredibly nice and made our evening!

pQxdn0W_koqqs4oV_P8lGA.text: I went here for lunch and was quite impressed. They were busy but we did not have to wait and were seated immediately. My mom ordered the Chicken Gyro and she said it was delicious. I ordered the Chicken Bacon Ranch flatbread. It did not have red sauce, which I thought was good since it already had bacon bits and ranch on it. It tasted delicious and didn't overwhelm me. I'm looking forward to coming back here in the future. This place seemed very organized.

LI6oZS6k9hUl__vFBUEWjg.text: This was my second time eating here, the first was much better. I went with my fiance at night and we were sat on the patio. The music was very loud but not a big deal. We ordered Buffalo blue chips as an appetizer and it was delicious but before we were done (as we were eating it) our waitresses came over and immediately started stacking dirty plates on top of it. She didn't ask is if we were finished but just pilled dishes on automatically. She also didn't check on us once besides to take away our slightly more than half eaten appetizer, no napkins, no refills.

dXnXhHvBI469FdCIXX79gQ.text: DNG is very comfortable and, excluding Fridays and Saturdays, it's always easy to get a table.  The club sandwich is tall and tasty and the seasoned fries are awesome.  Service is a little slow at times but always friendly.  Sunday brunch draws a huge church crowd, so yes, it's packed.  But as of March, I noticed they now serve brunch 7 days a week.  The omelets are great.  Bacon can be a little undercooked.  (Which seems to be a North Carolina thing because I can't get truly crispy bacon anywhere except at diners.)  And their grits look like cheese grits but they aren't, and they're still really good.

UPbN1A65Fc9WQSUSS0x30g.text: Stopped by during March Madness a couple of times.  I really liked the ground fl much better since the remodel.  The Miami style bar gives the place a lot more room and made it a good place to watch some games without feeling crammed into a corner. Beer and drink selection solid but not exceptional. Seems to have solid food, but I mostly have stopped by after dinner. Staff is pleasant to deal with and organized.

IOpRi2aXbtJG4DgJ2ZkQGA.text: Loved the spin dip and the carne asada taco. Great atmosphere for a family sit down meal.

AEY217QKUPkqPJUMzzd2qg.text: Hot and cold here. Nice looking place and I've had some good food here. But I have also had a way undercooked burger, a really long wait once (during a slow period) and my wife and daughter got sick right after eating there one time.  After the last incident, my wife said she wouldn't go back - so I probably won't either. Still not a complete waste. Maybe your luck will be better.  UPDATE - Been back a few times recently. Everything much better. In fact, my friends are big fans now. Moving up a star.

L8ELSj3nn5GUm5FkP4SHig.text: After having dinner there last night I decided to write a review.  The food was great the Philly is good with chunks of steak instead of slices chopped up. My favorite thing I have found after two visits are the homemade chips, always seem very fresh and have a great taste. The services was kinda slow had to ask for our drinks a second time. They also had ran out of Red Oak and Mich Ultra, are the waiter said they had. But they did have 3.00 NC Beers which was a good hit. All and all will return for sure.

gcsAJWU07CwBsxVyhwt_ig.text: This is a great spot to watch Carolina win!  Yes some dookie fans come and try to ruin the mood but that is a typical dookie.    The biscuits and gravy are to die for!  Always great beer specials and fast service.  I love the chicken philly (the fries here are probably some of the best I have had in Charlotte!)  The blood mary's are spicy and come with two giant olives - looooove it!  The patio gets shaded after lunch so I prefer to eat outside if I am there early.  Love Dilworth Grille!!!  :-D

v9ktgK4Xl2262q_hihoZmA.text: Was here for a late lunch. The place was empty in the back. Most of the patrons were sitting outside at the patio for it was a gorgeous day.  Our waiter, Alejandro was very knowledgeable and answered all of our questions with certain items listed on the menu. He provided exceptional service and came back several times to see if the food was to our liking. Asked him about other ethnic food, and he provided options.  Ordered the Western Burger and made to my specification of well done. Just the way I like it. No it was not a hockey puck. The fries were thinly sliced and tasty not with that greasy after taste.  My friend ordered the Steak Spiedie which he enjoyed cause he from NY and brings back memories. I tried a piece of the Steak and reminds me of Beef Kabob. LOL...

9zWy6ZwgFiVxTHW_SrSAww.text: Very poor customer service! There was a tall black guy with dreads at the front. He didn't greet me when I walked in, he was having a side conversation with another employee and made me feel like I was bothering him. Eventually someone else assisted me while he was on his cellphone. He should be working at McDonalds with that type of attitude, not an establishment like this.

NpNlD5HntTj3arg7Zdd8kQ.text: I love there Cuban. It is the best. Good and friendly staff. No my first visit. But, I wanted to give a review because they are good place for good comfort food.

pHZTYe17b4jLENx-Xo-jSQ.text: Nothing special here. Beer joint fare and so-so service. With our party of 8 one order had to be sent back since it wasn't what was ordered.   Limited parking and whatever you do don't park off the premises. The lot adjacent to this place boots cars nightly and their agent is typical of a predatory "parking service"  $100 bucks - ugh

-BZ29L84cRUeQJKD-m8KfA.text: Chicken /Pork Spiede is heaven on earth, well worth the drive from South Charlotte.  Other foods are also great, my choice is chicken spiedie since this is the only place in Charlotte you can get authentic spiede, (spiede home,  Binghamton NY).  Awesome staff and owners.

U-Dl51J3CljWeCpapaUElw.text: Your typical pub with typical pub food. I went on a Thursday during lunch because it is so close to my work, so maybe I would be more WOW-ed by the atmosphere if I came on a game day or late at night on a weekend. I was impressed with the Cajun seasoned grilled chicken BLT sandwich though which was on special the day that I went. And their drink specials seemed decent. Even mid day on a Thursday parking was tricky so highly consider ubering here if you can. Also, hold your breath as you're walking in because they share a front entrance, foyer like area, with a cross fit work out place which is downstairs and you are immediately bombarded by an overwhelming smell of stale sweat and old locker room fumes.  So, try to sit outside in their nice patio area and stay for the drink specials!

pk-2iWgUKGtmLgnNimEJLw.text: Sorry in advance for the really long review!  I really wish I could give Dilworth Neighborhood Grille more stars, but after last night we won't be back.  We have been patrons of DNG for the last 4 or so years as they are the bar for UT alumni and their football games.  I do not understand why UT has not received the memo that it is time to look for another bar, most other schools have - Uga, Auburn, wva, Msu, and others have all left.  It is now only UT and NCSU, as far as I know, which says a lot if a lot of groups are leaving.  I will say that DNG is a nice spot to grab a bite to eat when an event or alumni/team group is not there.  We like their food and have had a lot of their menu items, although disappointed they changed their menu last year and took off our favorite item.  The housemade buffalo chips are great!  My issue?  When they have a large showing like us UT fans, they are NEVER prepared and do not have enough servers - usually only 2-3 servers. It has not changed from year to year.   Last night was no different and our server was the worst we have had.  We (5 of us) were greeted early on, but then there was a long wait to get our drinks.  Kevin's sweet tea came first, then eventually my bar drink came, then eventually the other two bar drinks came (after finally being told that they were out of one beer), and finally a diet coke.  It was probably another 20-30 minutes before she came back to take our order.  The three others with us had their dinner served to them 10+ minutes before the sandwich that Kevin and I were sharing came out.  When she finally came by to check on us, Kevin asked for a refill on sweet tea.  She checked on us about 3 more times before finally coming back with a refill of unsweet tea...  Took awhile for her to come back for us to notify her about the mistake.  Again took a couple reminders to get sweet tea.  I wish I was off, but it took around 40-50 minutes before she finally got the sweet tea refill.   She told the manager how bad she was and he came by to offer a beer or dessert for him, but we were not interested at the time.  How about offer the sweet tea on the house, instead of charging us for it?!?   We decided 5 minutes before half we wanted to leave at half.  Since she had not come by our table in awhile we sent one of our people to track her down to pay.  She got two out of the three checks and asked if the third person wanted their check...really?? She did not return and we had to again ask her for the third check.  Halftime was over before we finally paid out.  Beyond that, they need more tv's.  Having only 4-5 in a dining area is pretty crappy for a sports bar.  DNG needs to get more servers or get backups to just come around to help with refills or make sure people have what they need.  They have yet to fix this issue each year, it is no different each game.  We enjoy going to be with other ut fans, but it is not worth it when they can't handle a crowd.  I'm disappointed we brought our guests to a place like this.  Goodbye DNG!

Mo3-YdI9nbQoaDK3IHcweg.text: The food was decent, however, the staff began cleaning the floor with Lemon Lysol during the middle of our lunch. The smell was unbearable and we ended up just leaving our half eaten lunch behind. Really was a waste of money.

HMcKTfaD7a5rlbbJCxPBLw.text: Tons of room and a really nice bar area.  The food is average bar food.  The best thing I have had there is the buffalo chicken sandwich.  I have been there a couple times for brunch.  The omelet bar is good and they do a nice job.  The rest of the food is pretty run of the mill on the buffet.  The mac and cheese is really plain.  Crab cakes are ok but they have been burnt the past two times I was there.  I really like the chicken bites on the buffet though.  There is also a decent desert selection with the buffet.

dyIaF58f1gQJv_TZ_OPRLw.text: Cozy neighborhood bar.  Bar food.  Seemed poorly managed due to the fact that some premium items were out of stock.  Ordered create  your own salad.   It was very good.  The bar was quiet and the televisions were great.

enKWHXu90-S7H_JFknz3HQ.text: Was excited to try this place. Many neighbors recommended it. I did order it delivery but was so disappointed. The burger (which I ordered rare knowing it would continue to cook in transit) was not good. It came in well done.... the avocado on it was not even near ripe. I also ordered wings char grilled. My wings were not char grilled. They actually look like another review where they ordered normal wings. I'm sorry but I'm not paying extra to not have them char grilled. Fries were ok but nothing special. Mine were actually not even crunchy. They were undercooked. Ultimately a total disappointment. Especially since the delivery took under 5 min from order completion to my door. Definitely not the drivers fault there

ffHnB0ubrMbdIS_ELAhHaQ.text: My guy and I came here the other night for trivia night on Tuesdays. I really liked it and to be honest could see myself coming here a lot more often on nice summer nights. I pass by this bar all the time and until the other night had no idea they have a outside bar seating area that allows you to sit at the bar but outside at the same time which is one of my favorite features of any bar. Clearly we were the new kids on the block for trivia night as everyone knew each other and at first it kinda felt like we walked in on some exclusive bingo club like the ones my grandpa used to go to but with younger people. Thankfully that feeling subsided really quickly as we had mentioned to the host when we ran in that we had come for trivia and we were like 3 mins late and rushed to the bar. Side note on that if you come to trivia night they start on time so don't be late or you could miss multiple questions they go by REALLY quickly.  I think the host could tell we had no idea what we were doing so he grabbed the needed sheets for trivia and brought them to us which was much appreciated that he went out of his way to help us out for being late and the bartender greeted us and told us the specials. They have 12 dollar beer pitchers on Tuesdays! We also had some food as well my guy had the cali burger I think it was called which he devoured before I could try it and he said it was pretty good. I had the beer cheese dip with a large soft pretzel to dip into it. It was just ok to be honest I couldn't really taste the beer in it it kinda just tasted like queso dip.  I have had the crab cakes on another occasion and would suggest that for an app over the dip for sure as those I do remember being really good.   Service was great and theres plenty of parking. This place was a little pricey compared to other places as we spent $70 on just the two of us before tip but it was definitely a good time and well be back for sure.

-tBUoxdlKt6H4DUPZJ-vpg.text: Super cool bar, great bartenders and great bar food. Cool please to chill and hang with friends, or get rowdy and watch the Panthers kick butt!

U6SN1j3Wz98wwNm49zAeJA.text: Great prices for the atmosphere and the quality was better than I expected.  Great sweet potato fries, shrimp tacos (I would have preferred grilled), broccoli is a great option, and the tomato bisque is great!

ICtWOD-TSWpHD4Tx0zTY3w.text: There are very few restaurants I am willing to give 5 stars to, and this grille is one of them!  By far, one of the most delicious American-style dishes I have ever had! Went here today with coworkers for lunch, and was surprised with the deliciousness and wonderful service that our group was given.  Ordered the blackened fish tacos with a side of seasoned broccoli. MY GOD. Perfect seasoning on both dishes, and with the perfect portion sizes!  However, a coworker sitting across from me decided to go with a veggie flatbread, and that will definitely be my next dish to try.  I say this because I will be back. Especially for that 10am-2pm BRUNCH BUFFET on Sundays. :p

OCamMMGd13RydvBEyCGuIw.text: The best part of my meal was the drink. The strawberry Southern Tea was great for $5. My husband's fries as well as my sweet potato fries were on the cool side. His burger was alright. My tacos were okay. The flavor good but the Asian coleslaw was on the wilted side. The wrong cheese was on the burger and she didn't notice until right when bringing it to the table.  The manager was apologetic and our waitress got missing for a while. With us you only get one chance! That's a one and done!

yies5PgrDv4EdyLFti8EVg.text: Dont call your beer cheese, beer cheese when it is really queso. But the garlic parm wings are amazballs.   Im here for the playoffs and got primo seats in front of the big screen.   More to come....

bIRJZLDbLQhgzyZTNfxY7g.text: Home away from home! Love the staff, food, drinks, atmosphere. Any week night, lunch, weekend, Sunday brunch. And now with the amazing update bar and outdoor seating I am IN LOVE! I recommend the Sunday brunch buffet, the BYO salad + grilled salmon, or any of the amazing appetizers. The bread pudding is made in house and SO tasty!

OrAIBjqfHH6I5h-s6PfusQ.text: This restaurant is right next door to where I work.  I wished I did not now know how tasty their bbq pulled pork and mac-n-cheese are.  These are two dishes I would not have ever ordered for myself.  I attended a luncheon and it was so savory and satisfying, I went back for seconds while nobody else dared to.  I could've gone for thirds.  The bread pudding is ok, also something I would not typically order and would not order again...but Idid eat the whole thing, anyway.  I will be going back for more bbq and mac-n-cheese.  Maybe even one of the signature salads! Parking is tough.  Your car will get booted if you park in the big lot in the back at the neighboring business.

004q-DHFMSsZrdGlgYaaVQ.text: Wow this place has 3 stars and I wonder why.  Sweet tea- garbage  Mac and cheese- garbage Quesadilla-garbage      We ordered so much food and didn't get a box because we didn't want any of it. Will not be returning. They are lacking in flavor and options.

Is6W84ndqpWss_ysV_Nrng.text: My first visit here and quite likely my last. Ordered crab cakes which have apparently won some award or the other. It came out and wasn't even warm looking golden brown almost like a fried green tomato. It had a lot of breeding and appeared as if the crab meat came straight out of a can.  The Asian chicken salad was ok-the best part of it was the dressing. The grilled chicken was not seasoned and also was not served warm.   If cannot imagine how this place remains in business if they cannot execute such simple items with the increasing competition from other great restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Do these look like crab cakes??  Guess I&#39;m spoiled by Del Friscos, Flemings or even 131 Main.

aeSSxXFTOfh9OLs8gNgE8g.text: The food was very good and filling. Beer selection was good. Service? Not so good. She never came around to offer a second beer. Had to wave down a separate waitress as I was dry. Asked for a little more sauce when I got my sandwich and it arrived with one bite of my sandwich left and I ate slowly. Fiod was very good though.

MwWvVH6rZiw-Xe_BmQ87IA.text: I recently visited Dilworth Neighborhood Grille for dinner with some friends.  It was a perfect night out so we were able to grab a table on the patio. The patio is large with several TVs and tables as well as high tops.  Our server was very friendly, but unfortunately somewhat MIA. Very hard to track him down and somewhat distracted when it came to getting us what we needed. I chose the Chicken Philly, which first let me say was huge. So, large portions which can be a plus. However, it didn't taste good at all. Not sure if they burned the mushrooms, onions and peppers, or if they were bad, but there was just a bad aftertaste in my mouth. Definitely wouldn't order that again.  The others got the Steak Philly and Black Bean burger.  Overall they said they were okay, but don't think the Black Bean burger was a hit. I will however say the Fries and Onion Strings are great! Overall it was nice to come back, since it has been years, but definitely not somewhere I would return to for dinner anytime soon. There is definitely better "bar" food elsewhere.

AXmZpSSqxZrnFdh1NPA3sQ.text: Bought a Groupon so we could try out somewhere new. Looked promising as they have an excellent patio area and we happened to go on 1/2 priced wine night.   Service was bad. Very bad. Although our server was nice, she forgot our wine, forgot our appetizer, and decided to sweep the patio instead of bring our checks when we were done. I try not to complain, especially when using a Groupon and getting discounted food, but when the manager came over to redeem the Groupon he asked how everything was. I let him know the food was great, but service was not. No questions asked, he handled the situation very professionally. For that I will be back.   Food was actually pretty good! I would say we started with the buffalo blue chips, but they came after our entrees. Still good though! I ordered the Southwest Salad with blackened shrimp instead of chicken and added avocado. It came with more shrimp than I expected and the dressing was great! Boyfriend ordered the Cuban and said it was alright. Their Sauvignon Blanc is very sweet-- would not get again.   Definitely going to give this place another chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southwest salad with shrimp

GzMToXslQK5jMDsZ9cE6oA.text: Not a great experience at all!  Been here quite a few times and it's usually pretty good but tonight was baaaad! Our to-go food took over 40 minutes to come out and when it finally did, it was luke warm at best.  Also, not sure what kind of coleslaw this is but I guess it was easier to just throw the whole head of cabbage in there lol.  The manager was great when she finally got involved but it was too little too late at that point.  Not worth it and prob won't be back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Coleslaw?

xMLMkj5nqM5b9w-PBCvJ7g.text: We swing by Dilworth Neighborhood Grille on Saturday for lunch and some March Madness.  Dilworth truly has a cool spot and I believe it is one of the most underrated patio situations in Charlotte!! The space is very large and their bar extends outside. When it is warmer, they lift the covering and you are in open air with a bar and tvs surrounding you! Additionally, they have a downstairs area that was being utilized for a private event when we were there.....definitely got some laughs from the noon time Sweet Sixteen dance party that was ensuing as we arrived!  They have a very nice beer selection as well. Typically I just go for Red Oak, as that is my drink of choice. On this particular occasion, my husband went for the Red Oak and I got the mojito in a mason jar as it was on special. The mojito was very nicely made and delish.  We decided to split the Ahi Tuna wrap with a caesar salad as our side, as we weren't too crazy hungry. The salad was very good and nice portion for a side. The wrap was very tasty with lots of seared ahi tuna inside.   Great spot that may become a regular outdoor seating option!

1LTgf27BGLgqzEozctNSHw.text: Cut the cancer out before it spreads! This is one of our fav watering holes. Bartenders are really good- Josh and Dave, specifically are above and beyond; food is always good.   Everyone in the place we've encountered has been friendly and helpful, except for one: Sunday brunch omelette cook - scrawny with pink hair. This person has gone out her of way to be rude to my husband both times of two that we stopped in for brunch, most recent being Mother's Day.   I hope management reads this and removes this tumor before she infects any of the other staff. Idk if we'll be back for brunch but if we do we certainly don't want to deal with this person's attitude. She shouldn't be anywhere near customers as she clearly doesn't have the desire to be of service. If I see her again I'll feel obligated to say something to her about her misconduct and I'd rather management do that for me.

eBkb1bGoftF0y6bHojIU_g.text: Found Dilworth on a random drive by while attending a convention in the city.  Did a quick Yelp and was convinced by the reviews of others. My experience was even better than I expected.  Service was SUPER wonderful and food was great. Rachel was our server and made stellar recommendations.  And manager, James, came by to personally ensure we had a great experience!  Would totally return if in Charlotte!  #GreatFind

gRuM8CZRh_qGgeflWswJ9Q.text: Service was a perfect 10 on a night when this was the official spot for Carolina alumni to watch UNC play Dook. So you know it was packed. Water was served in Large plastic cups, which means that it needed to be refilled less often (smart). Those who had beer never had to wait. The manager came by to check on us. I ordered spinach & artichoke dip. It wasn't my cup of tea, as it lack a creamy texture (a little dryer than normal) and there was a sweetness to the dip I didn't appreciate. It was edible, just not what I expected or what pleased my tastebuds. I would come back to watch a game, not for the food.

ek4TxI0BMMPWzOOwBFYMhQ.text: When I am stay in Charlotte it is usually to work the Grand Prix swim meet in May. This is the USA Swimming Officials hang out since it's just a few blocks away from the Mecklenburg Aquatic Center. As a matter of fact this Dilworth Neighborhood Grille has been a sponsor of the Grand Prix Swim Meet for several years.  Dilworth has there own private lot and when really busy I am unsure where customers park, it must be challenged. I never see any debris in the lot and it always seems like things are tidy on the exterior of the building.  I can honestly say after repeated visits there is a high level of consistency in both food and service. I have not had a poor service, or meal that I have not thoroughly enjoyed. The tap beer selection is solid with variety of NC Craft, IPA and domestics.   The atmosphere is fun and pub like around the bar. The dining room is more restaurant like and is suitable for children as they do have a kids menu. The adult menu is what you would pretty much expect and pub like with sandwiches and burgers. There are dinner dishes as well, but I have never tried them. They have some tasty appetizers like wings too.  It is not uncommon for large parties, banquets etc. to book here. They can accommodate a large party with special rooms and this usually does not distract from the customer service experience. However, on my last day in Charlotte a wedding party of around 30 hit the bar at once. It appeared to be a challenge, but I did not see where they could not handle.   I would encourage you to give Dilworth Neighborgood Grille a try if you have never experienced. I personally am a fan and will be back the next time in the area.

qoUzQXSbZT5OIbyuxJWAdQ.text: This gyro was great, and the homemade chips were also. I will recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family. I really appreciate the great service and prompt delivery .

Ctw5vqGO6IUrleR3CO_GeQ.text: I live and work nearby so I have been here often. My first time for lunch, I wasn't super impressed with the food, but the service was great.   Since then, I have been back a number of times and have always really enjoyed it. The staff is great and the food is pretty good. I'm a big fan of the chicken quesadilla (it is pretty spicy). They have great sweet potato fries and most other items on the menu that I have tried are tasty.   Trivia on Tuesdays is a lot of fun and there is usually a drink special every night of the week (NC pints on Tuesdays). Often times, we gather up a group of friends, order food and beers, and try our best to not end up last in trivia.   If you are looking for good burgers, wraps, salads, etc. with or without a couple of drinks, this is a great spot for it.

jNwJGYbJF9PWi9yRxQWzQA.text: Dilworth Neighborhood Grille is right behind my apartment building and there have been quite a few times where I have wondered about it but hadn't ventured over and boy do I regret not going sooner!  The bartender makes a perfect French martini and the food is good. I shared the artichoke spinach dip and it was as to be expected but what truly blew me away was the spaghetti dish. The portion was huge but it was perfectly cheesy and truly delicious. My boyfriend had one of their sandwiches and it was extremely good as well.  The service was as to be expected. We made the mistake of asking to be seated in the main dining room instead of the bar area and the waitress did make an effort to come check on us consistently.   I will definitely be back for the spaghetti again soon!

i4rCJitoSY7kkWdemwvA_Q.text: Typical bar and bar food. I am not overly impressed with the food. In fact, I came with friends and opted out of eating because I knew I could go somewhere else later.   Atmosphere is ok. Fun on game days, but I feel as though this place needs some serious updating.   Good beer selection. Beer, wine, and liquor drinks are all relatively cheap. They were having a wine tasting the night I was there which we enjoyed.   Overall, not my spot. I won't go unless invited by a friend. There are just other places I'd rather be.

YQfM1R1dZ5gHM9YC4Kmh5A.text: Their beer menu does NOT include their current offerings.  Ummm why have the menu then? Most of the beers I requested from the menu were not available.  Ordered a burger well done - comes back pink.  Not a good experience.    Place is cool - food & service were not.

n4nr62wiW0TNyLqPMMEzSg.text: Best burgers, great staff and plenty of seating. My wife and I have been in Charlotte for about 3 months, we go eat here at least once a week. Big variety on the menu and they are all delicious!

j-cibwhHvt6xgFL7tD7bIQ.text: Very chill atmosphere. Open late night. Bartender is very nice and helpful. The food here is amazing as well as their cocktails. Reasonable prices. Definitely would recommend. No complaints what so ever.

QMIfp6jwJeNq6imX9GaQBA.text: First time trying this place today. My first impression was that the environment was really relaxed and it seemed like a cool place to grab dinner and some drinks with friends.   I ordered the Berkeley Salad which consisted of spinach, carrots, onions, strawberries, mandarin, and smoked salmon with an Asian ginger oil dressing. I personally didn't think the strawberries mixed well with the Asian taste but they were tasty in the side. The salmon was pretty tasty although the cut was a bit small. Overall I did enjoy my food but I think the ginger oil dressing was a little too much oil for me. I'd recommend an Italian dressing or basalmic vinaigrette.    The service was pretty poor, our waiter in particular. He was very clueless the entire time and took a long time to get our orders. When my friend asked about an item on the menu he basically said he wasn't sure what exactly is all in it. He also never came back to check on us or refill our drinks. Three other women did come to our table to check up on us but that was kind of confusing because I had no idea who they were and if they worked there. They would spring up out if the blue.   Maybe we just got bad luck with bad service on the first day. I would like to try some of their other food items. Hopefully next time the service will be a lot better.

cVjZN5JIfIelmq0duwe7SA.text: Great place, great service, delicious food, but it's very loud and a ton of TV screens everywhere, a bit distracting.  And the food is a bit pricy.  Other than that I will def come back just not often, kind of crazy to pay $15 for breakfast.   You should go!  The food is worth it!

--yi_JD13h8jhxfxOZOyMA.text: Dilworth Grille is the best! They were so accommodating to our staff holiday part and the food was so good! I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone! Steven the server was awesome!

k6vvWtdGWoslRPYzUb9Tyg.text: This is our go to place to watch any sporting event. They have lots of TV's and really great food. The Carne Asada tacos are one of my favorite things on this earth. I can't bring myself to order anything different. They also have lots of great beer on tap!

a_sapnNLaLoXuzoy0OMleg.text: I've heard many things of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille and finally got to experience it for myself for a special event.  We were in the downstairs space (great for private parties and events) but the food was decent.  The event was for a running crowd so we loaded up on pasta, salad, and proteins.  It was your typical buffet line catering deal, but they still did a good job with the food (in my opinion).  The servers were very nice and came around with refills (even though I don't think they had to).  I will have to come scope out the bar scene or maybe catch a game or two here later.  The one minus is the parking situation is a bit tight... it was a weeknight when we had our event and the combined regular customers with our special event packed the parking lot.

DI7CPYp3ZbK1Eix2j1KyqQ.text: One of my absolute favorite places to go. My friends and I meet up there almost weekly for trivia on Wednesday nights. The staff is great and makes sure that you are taken care of. My drink hardly ever is empty for long, if at all.   On Wednesday night trivia the teams play for free pitchers of beer. The questions are pretty challenging and the host is very entertaining. I would highly recommend anyone go with some friends and try their luck at it.

Bjlmg-JHCteD7a7mjmW_NQ.text: This establishment is run by armatures at best.The service is inconsistent and servers are unintelligent.  Do not waste your money, or give it to the morally corrupt person who runs it. Why put money in the pockets of someone who cheats on their wife with the bartender, or allows employees to make death threats to other employees. But then fires the one receiving the threats. All around a shit show. No to mention the disgusting regulars that bring the class of the entire restaurant down. I don't want to be sitting by some loud guys objectifying women, dealing coke, and going around the corner to smoke weed.  All around a shoddy establishment that cares very little for the customer.  Most food comes in frozen, even their "fresh never frozen" wings, and all of their desserts are out of a box. Disgusting. Don't waste your time on this place.

bhfTJW6U5OCGJHbcY7oSWw.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch and ordered the tuna wrap w/ a side of mac & cheese.  I ordered the tuna rare w/ no aioli. The tuna was prepared correctly- not overcooked. But I have to say it was a bit on the bland side.  Lettuce was green & fresh.. Wrap was whole wheat. Mac& cheese was pretty good.  Overall,  DNG is not a bad place for a quick lunch.  No complaints about service.

8ny8OsqKYgxdwS4QFUqAMg.text: I hadn't been to Dilworth Neighborhood Grille in years before last night... I had a pretty good time, that being said...  First, they offer (or offered last night, due to the charity event, not sure which) a complimentary valet service... The lack of parking situation hasn't gotten any better since the last time I'd been, so that's a welcome change... From what I remember, the lot is pretty small so if there was a relatively decent crowd or the Big Chill (are they even open anymore?) was also having an event, it was a nightmare...   They haven't changed the interior at all, but honestly, why would you?  There's a little foyer and you can choose to go right down the stairs or to the right directly into a bar and there's a room that can be reserved a little further back past the bar on the first floor as well... It's a nice size, I'm sure you can hire it out for a party and whatnot... (I think I heard someone say they did that last night...) The bar is basic... Lots of wood, seating and televisions... Decent spacing, so that's a plus... The stairs leading to the downstairs dining area has railings on the left side, right side and down the middle which is awesome for when you're wearing platform stilettos and drinking... You can never have too many handrails... (Trust me; I've seen some things... Use the help when it's offered, ladies... lol)  The food was tasty... I enjoyed the little Chick-Fil-A-like nugget situations and the barbeque sauce was good... The pepperoni pizza was hot and fresh (perfect), but I could not get the blasted thing cut to pick up the pieces properly! lol  It took a little work, but it was worth it... I'm a big tomato fan and their sauce tastes like a thickened tomato soup to me, so that was right up my alley... Not a lot of additional seasonings, but it was a good eat... The crust could use a little something, though... Maybe some garlic or parmesan?  I couldn't have the meatballs (April 1st seems so far away...), but the boyfriend said they were just okay... We both enjoyed the spinach dip... If there were any artichokes in there, I straight missed them... It stood on its own, though... Creamy, but not too creamy... If it had a little bit of red or black pepper, I think it would have been perfect... We had the Goose Island IPA and the 312 for beers and they were yummy...  Overall, it was nifty and I'll probably head back when they have specials or something...

UJDjGn9nrjlLQBRWo23hHw.text: I have been to DNG several times and am surprised I haven't written a Yelp review yet. This place is a very nice establishment. The owner and most of the staff are very nice people. The seating is ample and atmosphere easy and comfortable.  DNG has a very nice bar with plenty of drinks to choose from, be it wine, beer, or spirits! The food menu also has lots of good options and even offering for vegetarians and vegans!  Their mixed drinks are always well made and i have yet to be disappointed by anything I have ordered from their kitchen. Also nine times out of ten the waiter/waitress are very nice and on point. Also the place is great for large meetings. Just call ahead and you can usually schedule an event for 20-50 people.

uVcJJ0a2bX_RnEq744JBaw.text: DNG has a great atmosphere for grabbing a beer and watching a game on one of their many big screen TVs. Their pizza is phenomenal and the rest of their food has been nothing but appetizing.   Their wine and beer prices are great and I enjoy meeting with friends here for drinks and dinner on many occasions.

KrWKB2W8aOVhZwN0ltoklQ.text: Great place but there lunch specials are really dinner. I dont want a steak or chicken parm for lunch. I usually have Tracey the bartender set me up with something since ive had everything on the menu

yr2K78SAG830OVXmpBkt1Q.text: cajun garlic wings are awesome!! great place for kids - seriously so awesome. my waiter was so patient with the two little ones -- kids eat free most days & they have coloring pages...and booster seats...seems like a silly thing to be so impressed about but you'd be surprised how hard it is to find a good place for kids!! house chips are amazing!!!

HqLbFXUdWLnixRiS4DorcA.text: Food was not great. Service good and a lot of TVs. Do not come here for food. Maybe to watch a game or 2.

uOzpcaJWV7vv__uo9c7YSw.text: Met two friends after work here.  One friend arrived first and grabbed a table - noticed when we sat down there weren't menus on the table - that should have been our sign to leave. There was one other table with people sitting - lots of staff around the bar and in and out of the room - but no one made it over to us.  After 15 minutes - I checked - a guy came over and asked if anyone had helped us?  No.  Okay - I'll check and see where your waitress is.  5 more minutes and another girl comes over with a backpack on - like her shift is ending - same question - have you been helped?  No - she goes and gets us menus and waters and says she'll check on our waitress.  After dropping off the menus, our waitress K pops up - hi guys sorry for the confusion (there's no one in the restaurant mind you) do you know what you like to drink?  Uh - we just got our menus.  K - Oh would you like to know the specials?  yeah that'd be great.  It was 1/2 price bottles of wine - we selected one.  She comes back with bottle open - she doesn't know how to uncork a bottle of wine and said she didn't know how to pour it either.  This isn't a fine dining establishment - so whatever.  We had to ask for a wine bottle chiller.  Then she asks if we want to order anything to eat - we all do - I said - hey if I get nachos would you eat some?  My friends say yes, so K says great - nachos - I'll go put that in - she was gone before anyone else could order.  Sigh.  Nachos arrive - unspectacular and clearly not enough toppings.  My friend asks if we can have some salsa ... it arrives in a salad dressing cup.  Uh - can we have another ... another salad dressing cup shows up. It's hard to mess up nachos, but these are unremarkable.  As we're finishing up she asks if we want another bottle of wine or anything else to drink.  Our friend asks if she orders another bottle, can she cork it and take the rest home because my other friend and I want to order a beer.  She says of course.  Beers come ... this bottle comes cork missing - K tried to open it herself and destroyed the cork.  Bartender comes over 5 minutes later and tells us he's brought us the wrong beers.  Brings the rights one and takes the others away ... K finds a cork for the bottle - friend has to ask for a bag to carry it out.  I suggest that my friend review the bill to make sure it's correct given how our evening has gone.  Final blow ... we got charged $1.00 for the salsa.  At least I was out with friends.

JjYdP1qIOYLkUcnX47S3Yw.text: Love this place.  Many choices on the menu to choose from and even a build-your-own salad.  Great beer selection and awesome new indoor/outdoor patio.  Great spot to either the family or meet some friends.  Awesome ownership also - Norm and staff are very accommodating as well!  Highly recommend!

H8BSfvZMRyauB59RMF6XdQ.text: We love this neighborhood restaurant. Food is always consistent. Fish tacos are always wonderful. Their flatbread are the kids favorites. Their buffet brunch offers something for everyone on Sunday. It is our go to restaurant for comfort and quality at a reasonable price.

WPngKp0k4gMVJT121-IEQw.text: Do not eat here. We came for lunch, waited an hour for 4 salads and a bowl of soup. The service was terrible. Waitress forgot bowl of soup and chicken for one of the salads. Upon request to correct the order, the staff delivered the chicken on a watery plate. I should have known then not to eat the food. About an hour after leaving, experienced symptoms of food poisoning that lasted hours. The restaurant comped the meal when we called to inform them about the quality of food. But that doesn't help much when you are incapacitated for the rest of your Saturday.

EVaUa_r_bzDK7302pvfEHA.text: Big fan of this friendly bar. Every time we stop in we usually sit in the bar area or at the bar. The staff is very attentive and fun, and we've met some pretty nice regulars. We've tried a lot of the menu and definitely love the Buffalo chips, and the blackened ahi tuna wrap, and the pulled pork on a pretzal roll..wow. Always a good time! Bar servers are the best!

6XjWTT9dLTcQdUik_GdabA.text: Crowded house is not only an underrated 80s band; its also an apt description for this place.  I come here because a couple social groups have this as their designated place to meet.  While it's not a terrible place I wish those groups would pick somewhere else less congested.  After going to similar bars like your Hickory Tavern, Fox & Hound, Jocks N Jills, etc. where parking is ample and in most cases a bigger bar area.  Here parking can be a nightmare with all the sports in the lot occupied during bigger events.  During events with larger groups its often difficult to get a server's attention.  To be the clear the staff clearly works very hard- some of them doing a lot running up and down steps- but with limited space and too many people its difficult for them to provide quality service.  Given that in terms of price, menu offerings and food quality there's really not a big difference from these and the aforementioned places I don't know why you would pick this place during popular bar hours unless you have a thing for enjoy parking lot congestion and having to elbow people away to get to the bathroom.  With Sunday ticket Panthers fans would be well advised to stay clear of this place when pretty every bar in town will have the game.

VkkIB9pUKv3k-m0wHDEWyw.text: Went here last night and order the nachos. My girl and I were pretty disappointed. There was barely any meat and just tons of lettuce. I might have jinxed it after writing such a positive review lol. I'll give it another shot sometime soon!

9dj5oV_gaX0yDtkx-M2i-Q.text: The salmon dinner here is sooo good. Very god bar food. The pizza is a little blah. Not that great. Nice seating area downstairs. Nice spot for lunch, just a little on the slow side.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon lunch with spinach. Wonderful!
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza. Nothing special

rJCjDqTNm04hpzE3pNxwgA.text: Ok this place is a nice cool spot. Huge spot!! Me and my sister ate here together for lunch on Saturday. We heard about this place from Taste of Charlotte one year and they were giving samples of their crab cakes to try.   We got the crab cakes for an appetizer and they were just as I remember them. And the sauce that does with it is good. I ordered the Italian Chicken Wrap and my sister got the Greek Chicken Pita Wrap. Both were delicious.

J2cVgCnsLtZvqvfQ9EyFuw.text: As far as neighborhood restaurants go, Dilworth Grille is one of the best casual spots to visit.  Here's why...  1. The atmosphere is lively and fun!  Great place to catch a game with friends, or come by yourself and make new friends as you're bonding over football.  2. The drink selection is pretty solid.  Bonus that I can get a mimosa on a Sunday and not be judged for not having a beer.  3. The food is very good.  This isn't gourmet by any means.  For a casual restaurant, their food gets two thumbs up.  Not only is the food quality good, but they have a great menu that has something for everyone.  The wings have a few interesting sauces.  The salads are a large portion and fresh.  The sandwiches are super yummy.  Prices are reasonable.  The parking can be a bit crazy.  If you're going to spend the afternoon day drinking on a Sunday, I would take an Uber and get there early.  This place gets really popular right before a Panthers game!  Good thing for the outside patio seating and plenty of TVs.

PSNOf2EgqMN6ZlWMSQ07bQ.text: I decided that I wasnt slaving over a stove this year for Thanksgiving. My bf was ok with us going out. It was a first for both of us. I reseached to see who would be open and had reasonable prices. I also didn't want to get dressed up. I zoned in on DNG. I made a reservation. When we arrived, we were seated in the bar area. I was glad we was not in the same room as the set up because I would have eaten too much! I was impressed with the Thanksgiving buffet!  Mac and cheese  Sauteed spinach Mashed potatoes Stuffing  Bacon Green bean casserole  Sweet Potato casserole Popcorn chicken Crabcake Fried turkey  Baked turkey Salad bar Fruit salad Omelet station Carving station  (prime rib and ham) Ice station (crab legs and shrimp cocktail) Dessert station (too many to list)  Our server Tracey was friendly, but not overpowering. Managers used earpieces to talk to the kitchen to tell them what to bring out to the buffet. They were hands on and that was nice to see. Plenty of TVs for us to watch the different games. And all of this was for the low low price of 19.95 per person! I was sold!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab legs, shrimp, and seafood salad
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Baked turkey wing, crab cakes, spinach

LPOoAF0U-OtZxsmNGwFwYw.text: Nothing super special about the food here. We came on a Monday night and didn't see many tables filled (not surprising since it was a cold, rainy night). We ordered the blackened fish tacos with sweet potato fries, the chicken gyro with rice pilaf, and the Suite 200 with seasoned fries. All of the food except for the gyro and seasoned fries was on the bland side, definitely needed salt. We're picky with our sweet potato fries and we're disappointed with these - soggy and bland. The gyro was really good and priced well. It seems like your typical bar food - we'll be back for trivia night!

nbWKKLCHU2FYLzupim9UYA.text: This is a bar/restaurant located in a nice area Charlotte. Immediately upon entering we were greeted and seated. The waitress came to our table several times to check up on us ask us how the food was and also get a drink and food order.  The waitress appeared very patient. At the time that we dined at this location it wasn't too crowded there were several families and single individuals at the bar having a drink. Food and drinks came out promptly the place was pretty clean. The waitress brought the drink out and I asked for straw she brought the straw out with her hands and place it on the table. She didn't use a napkin for the straw place it on a napkin. The thing was she didn't wash her hands because she just cleaned off the table with some chemicals then brought someone cash at no point did she wash her hands and placed the unwrapped straw on the table. Yes, I can be over the top but this was just nasty. They had to loose a star for that. I brought this to her attention in a polite way. The person I was with started vigorously praying over the food In fear they would contaminate it because I voiced that I didn't like how they handled the straw before the food came out. This isn't a 5 star restaurant by all means, but your day to day dinning place. It's a decent place for drinks or bar bites, but I do sweat the small stuff. Despite the single incident within the dinning experience....I think it's an alright spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish eye cab
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek Chicken pita
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. West coast burger with cheese

S6dEJXwIRZE1e08ii9kfSw.text: Smdh. I've heard so many wonderful things about Dilworth Neighborhood Grille, and in one night...that all went out the window. The service was more devastating than when I was dumped in the 3rd grade by Amy Myers. Some of the worst service I have ever had, and I've had bad. I'm still shocked from the events that occurred that night.  To start out the night, we had a fairly large party as it was a buddy of mine's birthday.  We of course start ordering some beers...which, I will hand to DNG, you can order in pairs.  It wasn't long after that the birthday dinner turned south... Everyone in the group was enjoying themselves, having a good time, when a gentlemen in our party started having trouble with his brew. He literally pulled a shard of glass out of his month from his pint glass! I swear on the Tom Brady's baby blue eyes, that's the truth. He surprisingly didn't make a big deal out of it, but WTF, that's scary to think he could have swallowed that.  The server said "sorry" in the most unremorseful way.   Then the food came out...well everyone's but mine and another person's order.  Simply put, we sat there empty handed and felt like the ugly, red-headed step child, forgotten and alone. Since we ordered in two different waves, we hadn't realize the amount of time that had elapsed. I finally went up to the server and asked what the problem was, and the look on his face said it all. He forgot to place the orders... I said to cancel the order since we were leaving and I didn't even receive a "I'm sorry". That was the straw that broke the camel's back, no pun intended... as it did happen to be Hump Day. I was hungry and you didn't feed me DGH- and you didn't even offer a simple "sorry". Sad! I have no idea what the food taste like here. Actually, I had a couple nacho chips and they were alright. But no main course!  In conclusion, no reason to go there unless you want to sit on their cool patio and watch a sports game. Don't know what the food tastes like but if it's anything like the service, it must be awful. That's speculative. Thanks for nothing Dilworth Neighborhood Grille.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Proof of the disappointment.

bqyKlULABWkjJoyTI_501w.text: We tried Dilworth NG on a Groupon! We ordered Cajun garlic char grilled wings (amazing), club salad, and chicken tacos! Everything came out really hot and easily good! All of this was ~$32 and we have a full meal just in left overs. Really impressed with the pricing and the food quality. It did take a while though, despite being mostly empty, so glad we weren't in a hurry. By the time I got the ranch that was left off of my tacos I was full and just took it to go. Paying with a Groupon is tricky... A manager has to see you to edit the ticket, a process that took a full 15 minutes. It made it seem as if they don't trust any other staff to support with that and leave it to the sole manager of a huge restaurant.  Definitely recommend if you're in the area and got some time. Looks like they have fun events throughout the week too!

p3RNKVxX3e6D0eE0_toLQQ.text: I came here for Sunday brunch last weekend with a friend and was greeted at the door. I had driven by this restaurant a number of times and was surprised how large it was inside.   We ordered the steak nachos to start and they were alright. What was great was they gave us huge portions and the nachos can definitely be shared. I got the buffalo chicken wrap with fries. I did not care for the wrap. It was done poorly and I did not care for the giant curds/chunks of blue cheese. I did like the fries though.   This is definitely a game day spot if nothing else. There were many fans for all different teams supporting their players. There seemed like there were many beers on tap and available so if you're wanting to go watch a game then it's great however the food was pretty so so

lQQu3-OK-c3wL5kYpilCxA.text: Dilworth grill is a modestly priced restaurant with decent food. (Not bad, not great). Today we had one of my worst experiences in a restaurant. 1) the waitress did not know, or find out the rotating drafts. 2) today the signs all said $3 craft beer. So I walked into the bar, saw ballast pointe on tap, and we ordered that. 3) my mother ordered soup. It came out cold. She had to ask twice before they could get a manager to allow them to heat it up. Then they forgot to return it. It came after we had all finished eating. 4) I was billed $7 for the ballast pointe beer. When I asked about the craft beer special the waitress said it didn't ring up as a special. She asked if I wanted to talk to the manager. I said yes. The manager wouldn't come, but had the waitress tell us it is an expensive beer.(which might be why I ordered it on special). See attached photos. I brought 8 people here expressly because $3 beer is allot cheaper that $7 beer. 5) and to top it off the charges for the cold soup that took forever to reheat.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

84qWyn9dW1Wb2UjDO838iw.text: It's so close to me that I've eaten here five times this summer.  Had their Steak Pub Nachos the first time dining in, pretty decent.  Big fan of their Ahi Tuna Wrap.  Their fries taste like McDonald's fries, which are good.  Sweet potato fries are good too.  I've also had their Spiedie, Club Wrap, and Greek Pita.  Pretty solid choices.    Good service the time I dined in.  Host staff is friendly, and the delivery comes faster than it says it does when you order online.  All in all, it's a pleasant experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak Pub Nachos.  HUGE appetizer I ate for lunch.

a2UIaxumEFCtSwEwkgiguA.text: This has been my go-to casual neighborhood bar for the past few years. The food is decent, they have a great beer/drink selection and it's never so crowded that you can't get good service. On my last visit, we had a minor food issue and it was handled flawlessly. The server checked on us shortly after getting the food, promptly addressed the issue, had a manager stop by and offer a free drink for the inconvenience and got us the correct food pretty quickly. Overall, a great experience!

2bvt5e2oJUKi-GeNyCeBpQ.text: I really want to give a 5 star review however the service here really needs tending to. We walked in with a party of 4 weren't greeted immediately, we got to our table and sat there for a while until the manager came over and asked if someone had gotten us drinks which we said no. The waitress came over within a few minutes. We ordered appetizers and meals. 3 meals came out after about 35 minutes and 1 meal was missing. Manager came over and said he was going to the kitchen to check on it. Came back up with it 10 minutes after the other 3 meals were already placed on the table. The food is good and we have ordered take out so many times just for the delicious chicken quesadillas, highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spinach artichoke dip, i liked it, my boyfriend was saying it was greasy
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretzel with beer cheese, very good!
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken quesadillas, we love these!!!

d_BSRf_oCbKOzyAsYtM_Uw.text: This is our favorite bar! It really is a nice neighborhood place to hang out and grab a great drink or a tasty bite to eat. They have good daily drink deals and Wendy, one of the bartenders, makes a GREAT margarita!

ltaarnAQ2o4_UdL_wxkCXA.text: Awesome place to grab beers!! Location, location, location. The outdoor patio is awesome!!  Only downfall is the bar tenders are slowwwwwwwwww. They saw my empty beer in the well several times and didn't ask me if I wanted another and almost appeared to avoid eye contact.

ZGfjG-VMgUSlY72SPjbsFQ.text: I was visiting my girlfriend's in Charlotte & they recommended this place. The atmosphere is amazing and so was the staff. The wings are to die for!

n0C12dO-0jHz6T-Q2IcjgQ.text: I enjoy the setting and location for events and gatherings. It has a great space for groups. This was my first time coming for a non-event, and I came for brunch with friends. $4 mimosas and bloody marys were a good deal, but the buffet was quite expensive for the food offered. It was okay, but I wouldn't be back again for food for brunch. I was quite excited to see they supported the Cubs, so I'll have to come back next season for that!

5hC-8CvvfbBJ7X9XhW8-Yg.text: It's all good. Just try as many items as you can! Service is excellent always. Every person on staff seems to love it there. Had the shrimp and grits tonight! Pleasantly surprised!

KSka-odYZtYOk0RPB7oyiQ.text: We had husbands 50th birthday party downstairs and it was a great venue for a party. We worked with Kait who was very helpful. Would definitely recommend for any event.

s8C88jK12m-7B_k_4V1Aug.text: We came here last week with a Groupon for dinner. I love how its open late and close to the CPCC campus. Basically everyone was at the bar, no one was really seated for a meal except us which was fine because I was starving! We ordered the beer cheese pretzel, the cheese had a slight beery hint and the pretzel was too salted for my taste, will ask for no salt next time. Cheese was good though. I ordered the shrimp and grits because jalapeno grits sounds delicious and the bf ordred the chicken spiedie sandwich. I loved the spice in the shrimp and grits but it could have used some salt and pepper..other basic seasonings but, the mild heat was there. Grits were creamy and there was an ok amount of shrimp. Had to take the rest home. I found the chicken spiedie really dry, the chicken has good seasoning so sauce of some sort would go a long way here. The service was a little slow but, it was also about 9:30 and nobody else was ordering food.   Wednesday nights are half off martinis. I got the white gummy bear, the bartender made it pretty stiff so it was well worth the price. We have also ordered the bread pudding for takeout, so yummy! I love the caramel sauce. Will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken spiedie
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretzel and beer cheese

Sil5f8Hfxp3Cb8ihGUNkmQ.text: Everything I've tried here has been delicious! The Mac and cheese is spooking yummy  I like that it has board games waiting to be played, in case you are looking for some entertainment with your meal. I have this 4 stars instead of 5 because the parking is lacking. There are not many spaces, and the lot is very narrow so that it's nearly impossible to turn your car around to leave.

GmRjCqpJ8XPBkof3tksbvg.text: Always a great environment with daily specials! Hard to find these deals anywhere else!

F7fHKi82cGdeBwovTevD2Q.text: I have only been to this place a couple times, but I have ordered take-out probably about 5 times.  If I could I would give this place a 3.5, but I am reluctant to give it 4 stars.  The menu selections for lunch and dinner are pretty broad, and they feature make your own pizza and salad option which sound interesting, but I have never tried.  I like the Greek chicken pita with pasta sald, and the hummus- they are the only things i have ordered.  My mamma and my boyfriend reported that their food (burger, club sandwich and fries) was just average, so I give this place 3 stars.

8HzP3NNuF703YPvmqOg0oA.text: I went on Friday with a group before a performance at the Actors Theater of Charlotte.  I do not understand the hype. Bad location and poor parking.  Its an okay bar/grille.  Before going here I would go to the Midnight Dinner.

W6iAa6A71iu_fjhBWd0n_A.text: Have eaten at this bar many times over the years. The food was really good a few years back even a couple of months ago. Went twice this month the food was not good. Had the club sandwich look nothing like a club sandwich had to cut it myself and was very dry. My boyfriend had wings and fries,wing where warm ,not fresh and fries tasted old. Will not be going back  ):

FJBujph2sgryNCd7EItcTg.text: We headed over to Dillworth for a Sunday night dinner this week.  The restaurant is under going a remodel, but there were no troubles in getting a table. Seems like they want to go for a more upscale feel than simply being a neighborhood grill, and that's cool. Private parties are where the bucks are anyway.   We knew the place had never had decent sweet tea the previous three times we had been there over the last few years and that hasn't changed.  To the owners: Guys, you are in the south now and everybody isn't going to drink beer or other beverages, though I realize we are in the minority here on that one.  Tea that tastes like a mix with sugar thrown in is just gross.  We both opted for some other beverage and my Doctor Pepper was flat.  Sadly, the guy that seated us that looked like he might be the manger refilled my glass once and he didn't notice the lack of fizz, either.  I have drank flat soft drinks before so it wasn't a deal breaker.  My fiance's Delmonico Steak Sandwich was incredibly fatty and messy.  His homemade chips were alright, according to him. He took the steak out of the bun and cut the fat out just so he could eat it.  I opted for the Chicken Spiedie Wrap and was a lot happier with my meal.  I wouldn't want the spiedie sauce every day, but the way they marinated the chicken in the sauce and whatever makes it taste like something other than just Italian dressing was a nice change from what you  might encounter at other places.  The previous times we have been were during the week and there were special items available for that day. We had always been pleased with those.  I don't think we will be going back on the weekend, and I don't think we will be increasing the frequency of our trips to DNG, either. I give them 3 stars simply because in the past the food was always really good for both of us, but this experience was really sub par. I hope this was just a weird quirk that wouldn't happen again if we went back next week.  My bottom line is that it is a laid back place, comfortable and a perfect place to hang out with some friends and cold drinks on the patio or in the bar. If you are a supporter of one of the football teams that they used to be the base for - they didn't have the flags hanging up when you made your way downstairs, so I don't know if that has changed- you'll love being there on Saturdays.  I might give their Sunday brunch a try down the road sometime, but I don't find DNG to be so spectacular that it warrants a drive down from University just to eat there.  I would, however, recommend trying the Chicken Spiedie Wrap just once since you aren't going to find anything like that anywhere in town.

0FMbqEbNRhyaZxRZJlhqeg.text: Good food consistently (except the pizza - avoid) and a genial atmosphere. The service I've had has been good to great and the prices are very reasonable. Terrific spot for lunch, I go there often.

n6u_Cw_SsgLBsHW9JAkfjg.text: Went to watch the Super Bowl. The setup was nice, it had neighborhood bar feel, which is expected given its name. The waiter warned that the kitchen was really busy. So I ordered the shrimp tacos ( recommended by the waiter)and a strawberry sweet tea right before kickoff.  The drink came quickly and was the perfect combination of sweet, strong, and refreshing.  However I had to wait until halfway through the 3rd quarter for the tacos to arrive. I opened the aluminum foil to take a bite of the taco and it was a steak taco. Fearful that if I requested a change, the tacos would come well after the game was over, I took a bite of the steak taco. It was flavorful but had way to much gristle. It made it chewy and difficult to enjoy.  Return for the drinks, not the food.

XTsiDzmnZULqBh52VE36Jw.text: I come to Dilworth Neighborhood Grill for the build your own salad. Nothing else in the menu has impressed me. The build your own salad is reasonably priced, can obviously be tailored to your preferences, and is a large portion.  I typically eat outside on their patio which is basic and not the cleanest. My fiance is not a big fan of this place as he's not a salad as meal kind of guy, so I typically come here with female friends.   The outdoor bar could be a decent place to hang out (they have fans). The crowd here is typically a little older than many of the places is this neighborhood.

nCFqlEGIWjWDhrpZJ3fr4w.text: So I ordered the buffalo chicken pizza and it was terribly undercooked. You can see how I pulled the raw dough with my finger and if that's not enough just look at the cheese!! The pizza was 70% cheese, please fix the ratio. Sad food. Bleh

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

y9SXHFXNyH5pTLgTZX3dmA.text: My coworkers and I usually always hit this spot after work but it's been very disappointing today. Barely anyone is here but the service is terrible. It has taken over 10 minutes just to get a drink (even at the bar). I could see if the place was busy waiting, but there are maybe 15 people here all together.  Very disappointed.

zfGF4oafCehGs3FT2fk3CA.text: Had a table of 6 to watch SEC Basketball finals.  They tuned the tv in front of our table to the game so my husband wouldn't have to turn around.  Service was a little slow but all in all not bad.  They did mess up our wing order (we didn't even notice) and comped us another dozen. Quality of the food was good.  1/2 rack of ribs were huge and very meaty.  They had a decent draft selection and even have Bold Rock Rose on tap.  I would definitely stop by again.

pTR_p__nYT4TPWYNMg2htw.text: Came here to watch college football becuase it was walking distance from my apartment. The hostess wasn't knowledgeable about the games being shown in the bar and we ended up sitting on the end of the bar because we luckily found 3 seats. We ordered appetizers and a pizza to munch on while watching the badgers game. The bartender was nice, but the guy bartender knew more about games and was able to change the channel on the TV above us so we could watch. The appetizers were unimpressive and the pizza's cheese tasted like cardboard and we didn't take home leftovers (half of the pizza). The patrons of the bar seemed to know each other and it had a very "neighborhood" feel to it. Parking appeared to be an issue and there is not a lot of spaces  around the bar to park.

_AOgQmE82Yo1eY5MpnL9Fg.text: Pleasant atmosphere; Immediate greeting, seating, and drink order taken. Weekday 2 PM, the employees outnumbered customers and still the food order took 25 minutes to arrive at the table. Prevailing music, selection OK but volume far too loud. The food was presented well, but nothing remarkable, neither good or bad. Waitress was attentive but kitchen was very slow to produce lunches that were not complicated. If you have lots of time for lunch, this is OK, but better skip if you are in a hurry.

wArroLra959KCWsQ6ElEyg.text: I came here with a group I volunteer with on a Tuesday night and we were seated immediately. The waitress was very attentive at first but sort of avoided us after there was an error with someone's food. He admittedly made a bit of a stink about it, so I can't blame her. All said, even the manager stopped by at one point to say hello, so it's safe to say we were well taken care of.   I opted for the crab cake BLT and the homemade chips, and it did not disappoint. The crab cake was huge, the bacon was crispy, and the buttery bun with a bit of homemade tartar sauce was mouthwateringly good. I went a little crazy and ordered a side of ranch to dip my chips in and, again, did not disappoint.

-IshgPOANEg7hXpZt52esg.text: It would be nice to have friendly staff and provide an accurate time for pickup orders. After I ordered online and I received an email stating my order would be ready for pickup at 1:05pm, I waited 20 minutes. The hostess, Danielle, was rude and had to be told to go get her to-go orders that were piling up downstairs. The only thing she said to me was "we're really busy" with no apology. When she got my food and others', she walked over to people who came in after me and gave them their food in the dining area. Once she finally came back over to me at the front, she handed me my food with no sorry or thank you.

D2ZMQ0EsKWQV6MQIfQUo0g.text: Food was fine, never experienced worst service in my life. The server couldn't comprehend a simple drink order and once it was ordered it took at least 20 mins to get it. Finally just started going to the bar.

W7AgPAeKfNVMdC4Fz1mHQg.text: We made reservations for our group of 17 for 730. By 840 we had not ordered. When the food came, most was cold and 4 orders were wrong. 2 meals had the be returned twice. My husband ordered a pizza but just ate the sandwich he was given. At 9:15.  The quality of the food, other than being cold, was fair. Spoke with the manager who apologized and explained he was short-staffed and busy. I kid you not, other than people at the bar and our group, there was only one other couple in the entire restaurant.

TuyHWstWvoQicAFOgd9vtQ.text: CLT5 rated this bar as a top 6 place to watch the panthers game. Service was good. Wings were too salty and as far as the game..... well the sound NEVER matched the televisions, the games buffered and often they were frozen in pixelated mode. I literally had to watch the game on my phone at the bar while the tv's were stuck in art mode.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

iwo-0zfK4d1YaiHtTaiZzw.text: I had high hopes for this place because I enjoyed coming here last season to watch football. Friend and I gave it a try on a Saturday afternoon and there was only one other table dining in the restaurant. Waited over ten minutes for someone to take our drink orders.  Then waited a half hour for our food to come. Ridiculous considering there were only two tables dining in at the time. Lots of waitresses standing around not doing anything.  Our waitress would disappear and it took a long time to get drink refills or order another beer.  Their menu made it sound like they were the only place in town that had spiedies on the menu so I wanted to learn more about it before I ordered it.  I asked the waitress what it was like and her exact words were, "chicken with some spices. I don't know how else to describe it." I went against my judgement and ordered the chicken spiedie that came on a hoagie roll. I will say this, the chicken was very moist however, it did not taste good at all. The sandwich was just a hoagie roll with cubed marinated chicken on top. I'll post a picture so you can see what I'm talking about. Overall it was a very disappointing experience. I'm not sure if I will even be back to watch the Panthers next football season since the service and food was so bad this visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken spiedie

58eVac-qby8OHIDU-c8c_A.text: We had a birthday party there for a good friend. There were about 20+ people there. The folks there was amazing. We were treated like royalty there. It has outstanding food and wonderful people. The prices were good for the food you received. I WILL GO BACK

graZjA19XZzWYfN1wN65aA.text: No very impressive.. big place looks like the bar would be cool. I have only sat in the dining room though. Mediocre fried bar food .. I'd pass.

eQ26FL9dSO8vvGOHvE-3mQ.text: I've been here a few times and feel confident saying this place is decent enough. Not great. Not terrible. Decent.   On the most recent trip- we went around 10 pm on a Saturday after a movie. I was surprised to see the place was totally dead. Other than a few people (like, four or five) sitting at the bar, we were the only ones in there. Dave was our server and he was great. Quick service, checked in with us - no complaints. Now we are in the midst of wedding fitness but this was a cheat day, so we started with beers. They were alright. They would've been better if the glass was frosted or just served at a cooler temp in general. For meals, my fiance got the wings (he loves them, I think they are just okay) and I got the buffalo chicken sandwich in a wrap. I tried the sweet and spicy sauce and it was okay.   If there is a common theme in this review, it is mediocre. Will we be back? Probably. Is it a top spot in Charlotte? Nah.   *side note, I've heard good things about the brunch but never had it. On my list to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wings - dry rub and Cajun garlic
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo wrap with chips

BP94Qs83vABpwbPLVxlGSQ.text: Great food, great service, friendly staff and welcoming atmosphere. Every day has a different drink special which is exceptional. Go Dilworth!

y-oZjWhrOgxGxbmj7iHuaQ.text: Just pick somewhere else. Trust me. Slow work lunch service that made people late for a meeting. My pizza never came until everyone was almost done eating and it was cooked - tasted like raw dough. Blech.

Ze_S0_1Begi1usas6hNetg.text: Let me start by saying I downloaded yelp just to leave a review about how disrespectful the wings I received were. I ordered the Cajun Garlic Sauce wings. Dry dry dry. I felt like I was biting into a piece of rubber. The sauce was non existent and I had to pay $1 extra for all flats or drums that I did not receive  (who does that).
