There was no flavor...like no seasoning, no nothing; just super hard fried wings. They literally looked like the skin of a hairless cat. The quesadilla however was bomb and that's why I'm giving it two stars.

s4sXIgRy-olCKb70e84j7A.text: It's a staple if you are starving and need something to eat.  Nothing to go out of the way for.  The service was lacking and don't event give me crap that it was an NFL Sunday.  The football season comes every year and the games are always on the same day.

2U3LZBfp9XTXMyWYqoL3pg.text: first, my disclaimer:  i have done business with DNG beyond the scope of pulling up a barstool on a sunday and screaming at the many televisions while drinking reasonably priced draft and bottled beer and stuffing my face with their tasty barfare grub.  they have a decent cheesesteak, i am always a fan of chicken fingers, and their fries are not to shabby either.  i can totally understand why so many college and pro fan bases have chosen DNG as their home base for rooting on their squads.  Norm, Oz, and Chris are an amazing owner/manager team that have hosted a number of charity events for me over the years.  we have utilized their downstairs on a number of occassions to host the Beards BeCAUSE Clean Shaven and Five O'clock Shadow parties.  they have always been extremely accomodating to our needs as we entertained crowds in the 120-180 range.  they always put the staff on that could handle the crowd and still have fun with the patrons.    for the reason, i have recommend Dilworth Neighborhood Grille to others looking to throw charity events on a budget that have been successful.  they are good hearted business people that ensure a good time.

ZHDSk9ZCdYyRhZaqocqaPQ.text: We really enjoyed this place.  We ate lunch here yesterday.  The Delmonico Steak Sandwich was really good, the homemade chips and the fries were also great!  My daughter had a grilled cheese and literally ate every bite.  My wife said the sweet tea was really good too.  The service was awesome.  I would definitely recommend it!

lqV50wIluWkyu6LO4Od8tw.text: Good Bar food.  Nice staff.  Fun place to watch a game and have a beer.  Matt (owner) SUPER !

DnTTkQCw-PNbMarEBnyuCQ.text: I loved the black bean burger.  Its a nice place for lunch or late night snack.  My gf felt the fish was under cooked so I would avoid that.

HDGfCSCs3JFZlUh3WQSaIA.text: I brought my friend's cool kids to Dilworth Neighborhood Grille for lunch. Aidan (age 8) and Benji (age 7) told me their favorite food in all of the world is the pizza here. Thanks for being the best. We loved our lunch!

vhxWgUdW_BXca6wNLCCoMQ.text: The food is decent enough, but unless you're sitting in the bar it feels like you're in a banquet room. Which, essentially, you are. Service can be a bit of a crap shoot. I've experienced good service there, but consistent it isn't. There are other bars/restaurants in Dilworth that are much better.

jclNwq08YhuXV3We74k8Hw.text: I met some friends at this place a few weeks ago because of its proximity to uptown. What a fun little spot. Its kind of sports bar in the front, restaurant in the back, and more seating downstairs (I was told). The bar area was a bit noisy....but it IS a bar...with lots of TV screens. But it wasn't so noisy that me and my friends couldn't have a conversation, order food and enjoy some cocktails. The food was above average for a bar, and out of 4 girls, we were all more than satisfied with our choices. Service was good. A very happy experience. I can't wait to go back in the spring and sit outside on the patio. Parking was a bit tight, but it is in Dilworth after all..being from a larger city myself, you learn to get creative..ie...park across the street and walk a block..no biggie in my book.

5sH3WiiEQSkhbBYzuGgPxg.text: This place tries to be like the old Mick's chain in Atlanta - an Applebee's or Ruby Tuesday, but with fresh food, executed well. Unfortunately, the food's just not that good. The Italian meatloaf isn't awful, but it's nothing to write home about. The apps were decent, but not great. My GF loves their black bean burger, though (and it IS pretty good for a non-meat burger). It's a good place to watch a game,but not as a dining destination.

M7Qg0sFoAEdsPzQ9aL-Yng.text: I frequent this place with my co-workers since it's right down the street. Each time we go the service is pretty decent. Sometimes slow and sometimes on point but they're always friendly and get our orders right. Their black bean burger is delicious. Full of flavor and a favorite go-to of mine. Their tuna wrap is pretty decent with a hint of unexpected spicy to it.

qkzBV6Z0rTTIwchVfd2QKA.text: Good, friendly service with a great atmosphere. The food is average and overpriced.

K75Q9gaBpoqvdJiuTVqaJg.text: Thank you Dilworth Neighborhood Grille for hosting a great holiday party for our group!  We had approximately 150 guests and your staff was friendly and extremely helpful.  The food was great and our guests truly enjoyed themselves.  We look forward to working with you in the future!

sz5qsAQIO6xMWbUNU2CULQ.text: Although a pretty loyal customer to Dilworth Neighborhood Grille, I've got to give it a 3.    My group of friends and I have been going there for going on two years, mostly on Wednesday nights for the trivia.    The food, overall, is better than your average bar food.  They tend to have a lot of variety in their specials and they're reasonably priced.  They came out with an updated menu about 8 or 9 months ago, and to my dismay, the nachos were taken off.  I still occasionally talk the waiter/waitress into getting me chips and queso with jalapenos, chicken and salsa on the side, but it's just not the same.  Would highly recommend the make your own salad or pizza.  It seems like there is a high-level of turnover in the wait staff there.  Not sure if that's a function of it being a Wednesday night and no one wants to work during trivia, but it could be.  Overall, it's a good place to go, but I'm doubtful that it stays a regular place on my rotation because they recently changed the guy doing trivia, and that's part of the only reason we go.

rXj9sl8Bmg2ZF9Gc4CvsNA.text: I've been here when this place has been packed, such as on select weekend nights and for Wednesday trivia, and when it has been dead.  It generally seems to be a pretty popular place, especially on game days, and there is plenty of room both upstairs and down.   The food is pretty average for a bar, but they do have one item that is truly unique: the Buffalo Tender Dogs. Buffalo chicken fingers on a hot dog bun, with cheese. Me likey.   I've never been here during lunch or breakfast times, but the menu seems to have plenty of items for any meal.  Prices are decent, about what you would expect, which means you can get out for fairly cheap.  The service, both at the bar and at the table, has been good the times I have visited. There are a few tables outside as well for those nice nights when you want to escape the smoke inside.  Nothing special, but a decent place to spend the evening.

MlG_i5yhSU-RO9MlzmbLdw.text: OK, so I had to add in the Sports Bar category to this restaurant, mainly because every time I've been there has been for a big game. So while this place may be a nice lunch or dinner spot, the "sports bar" aspect is pretty good for watching a game.  Having two levels, there is a lot of seating but still tough to get a table unless you get there early for the game. Downstairs, they bring out the projector to broadcast & turn on the audio over the speaker systems. If you are able to get a seat downstairs, then this place is great, but if you get there late & are stuck in a horrible viewing arrangement, then you won't enjoy your visit. And if you're a Tar Heel fan, then you'll appreciate that both Carolina - Dook games I've watched here, the Heels have stomped. Count me in as superstitious.  I've only picked at some finger foods my friends have ordered here, so I can't really comment on the menu. But from my limited tasting & looking, the food seems quite tasty & filling.  For me, Dilworth Neighborhood Grille is a place my friends & I can go outside of the hustle & bustle of downtown to catch a big game (preferably the Tar Heels). If you're looking to join in with a bunch of other Heels fans, then head over here for the next big bball game, but just remember to get there early.

3920NJ1Tt_CfyfT9OvO7Ww.text: Dilworth Neighborhood Grille has pretty good bar food (burgers, fries, etc) and good drink specials. My boyfriend and I got some late-night food and beers there the other night. $2 pints are always appealing - especially in these crappy economic times. For football fans, Neighborhood Grille is a good place to go on game days. But a word of warning...if you're not a football fan (ahem, like me) it can be a pretty loud, obnoxious environment. Neighborhood Grille now serves breakfast. I plan to check that out next.

ZDSYo2UFlNajA9RDA8gA4g.text: Friday night $2 drafts and some tasty wings...Always a good time here. Friendly staff. It is in a good spot, but go early for a parking place. For football this is a great place to go.

OFlAl8uoN9WWa6NGdiGUVg.text: Awesome neighborhood Bar and grill. Staff is super friendly and food is great! If you are a NY sports fan this is definitely the spot to go!!  Nice outdoor area too.

EFMrRRGmuvjsPEQbjfKTdw.text: I have only been here for their Sunday breakfast but this place is never a bad choice in that they serve good food consistently. The atmosphere is your standard bar/restaurant type deal but it is nothing out of the ordinary and after a couple times here you feel at home and it could be a plac you'd want to come and hang your hat, so to speak, and have a pint. The one drawback is that, if you are familiar with the location you may have some leftover preconceptions from the old Graduate days. Beyond that I would definitely recommend stopping in for breakfast or a lunch.

fbHAkXWCiGbdp_g7p47A1g.text: With free entree coupon in hand we decided to check out Dilworth Neighborhood Grille. After all, we live in Dilworth and it's always fun to try a new place. The space is attractive and has a lot of seating, with a large bar area and lots of TVs for superior sports watching. Service was also pleasant and prompt. Unfortunately the food we tried (other than the house salad, which was fresh and good) was nothing special. The slaw on the BBQ platter was not very flavorful and the BBQ itself didn't have any kind of smoky appeal. The mac & cheese was OK but not great. As for the shrimp and grits, to me it was way too cheesy/greasy- some may like all the cheese but definitely too rich for my taste and not enough distinct grits flavor separate from the sauce/cheese. This would be a fun place to watch a game and definitely good for the drinking set. Of course I only tried a few items from the menu, but from what I tasted the food is not the draw here.

gKbvX6s3LPJX0c7_gwpFtg.text: This is definitely going to be my new hangout spot. I went on Wednesday night for the first time, and when I walked in, I was like "wow", this place is humongous. We read that they had trivia, so we came pretty much for the trivia, which is on Wednesday nights at 8:30pm. The trivia was pretty good too...topics such as 90's song lyrics, movie lines, college mascot nicknames, etc. The winner for each round got a pitcher of beer and the winning team for the overall trivia got gift cards. We won the round for college mascot nickanmes, but we had already had a lot to drink and had to work in the morning, so we ended up giving the pitcher to another group. The drink special that night was $2 dollars on domestics. They also have a pretty good menu. We tried a 12' Build Your Own Pizza, which was absolutely delicious. The prices were dirt cheap....total tab was under 20 bucks. They had a downstairs that was non-smoking (which is great), but unforturnately, the trivia was held upstairs in the smoking area....I sure can't wait til January when smoking in bars and restuarants will be no longer.  I fell in love with this place in the few hours that I was there. I will definitely be telling my friends about this spot and I will be coming here regularly.

3N3WZcXvCt1-KvMWhmdKLg.text: I rented this place for my daughter's graduation party and everyone loved it.  We couldn't find a place at the last minute and contacted Dilworth Grille.  Kait sent us the details and within a few hours  we had a spot for the next day booked. Kait made the whole process very easy and simple. Everyone enjoyed the food and had an awesome time.  Paid a great price for the food and spot, check them out!

WTa8ksj2mxeSB_hjv-of4w.text: The Dilworth Neighborhood Grille is a restaurant that has something for everyone.  They have all kinds of food choices...from salads to sandwiches, burgers, and seafood.  You can ask for a gluten free menu...lots of choices.    There is an outside patio that is heated during the chilly days.  The restaurant is casual. TVs for the sports enthusiasts and several tables for dining.    I went wirh my boss for lunch so I didn't take pictures like I normally would.  She chose the choose your own salad.  What a great idea.  You get a list of items ... probably 40 different things.  You can choose as little or as many you would like.   For $8.95! I had the chicken gyro. It was delicious.    Definitely a place I will go back to.

8hxvRuOxbFOzRJS3PRC1Cw.text: Grabbed lunch here a few times and typically the food is awesome.  Unfortunately this wasn't all that.  I ordered a blackened salmon Caesar and though the salad was delicious, the salmon was completely raw.  It looked though it was seared on four sides and served --sorry, wasn't looking for Sushi today.    The staff are super friendly and polite, and prices are very reasonable.   There is a ton of seating inside, and some seating outdoors.  The parking lot is a bit limited but there are typically spots available.    Overall a bit disappointed today, bought past experiences have been great.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Caesar salad.
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

Nnu8BYzMcRGPmNfFGT2iKA.text: Came for the Drag Brunch with friends and wouldn't come back for the food nor the drinks. The show was entertaining and price value is justified. But don't expect smiles or helpful service staff. Guess the Sunday morning shift we encountered was still too tired.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

9JSSkLGmfNItqRrN2xg6XQ.text: I can only speak to my experiences from having their food delivered. This place is a solid go to and I really have nothing bad to say about any food here that I've had. I enjoy the menu variety, seems like there is something for everyone. With that being said, you can't expect everything to be perfect or fine dining worthy. For what it is and what I've received I would recommend.

0KQOi34sZRaI9qvgxBzZ6Q.text: I really want to give a better review but I waited nearly 2 hours for my food tonight. I arrived 30 min early to make sure I got my order in before a watch party game started, and tables all around me who arrived way later than I did got their food before us. Our server was kind but to say the manager was to busy to even comp us one dish is just rude and bad business. We will likely never come back.

nLCj1iNT3m83G7Ye0kxAxA.text: Do yourself a favor and take a hard place on this place. I live in Endicott NY which is where the spiedie originated so I was excited to try this place dispute the bad reviews. I should have listened to the previous reviews. Gross food, waste of money, take a hard pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo chicken spiedie pizza

vFza4jxZxp1hh28PKQD3CQ.text: This review is for their takeout services.   My husband and I decided that we wanted wings last night, and being home with a newborn limits us to takeout/ubereats/delivery/etc. we decided to go with Dilworth because it's close, and has always been a good spot to grab bar food. Prior to ordering, I called to see if we could get the wing flavors split, and the woman said, no problem, you can do two flavors. I also asked if their wings were grilled or fried, if you got them tossed in sagar, and she informed me that any of their wing styles can be grilled. So, we went online and ordered away.   Fast forward to getting the food and opening it at home, we were shocked to see that our wings were only one flavor - not either of the flavors we ordered, and there were only 10. I went back online to make sure I didn't order wrong, but their menu clearly says "12 wings". So not only were we two wings short, but they were not the flavor we ordered either. I tried calling back, but no one answered, and well, life with a newborn, I got busy.   Overall, the wings weren't that great (pretty small) and not worth the price, considering you'll only get 10 of your 12.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

9viaHwESiEDuyacUbuu1WA.text: Came here for an early dinner on a Saturday afternoon.   The bar nor restaurant were busy.  In fact, there were probably three tables occupied at the time.  We were immediately sat.  We ordered our beverages and looked through the menu. Our waitress kept disappearing and was not available when we needed refills or wanted to order another round of drinks. We ordered our food and it took absolutely forever until it came, possibly close to 25 -30 minute mark.   The chicken tenders and chips were very good. The chicken tenders were large and the breading was just how I like it - not very thick.  Really enjoyed their honey mustard dipping sauce.   Sadly, the poor service overshadowed the good food.   Parking during this visit wasn't an issue due to the time of our visit.  However, their parking lot is small and the spots are tight.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

BqGU26UqgSROBZEfgZ1W2w.text: Let's see... Dilworth is a small town bar in the middle of a fast growing city. Lots of seating with a decent size bar and several TVs. Great spot for a game night or a good spot to pre game. Parking is always scarce but they just opened up more parking across the street. The bathrooms tend to be a little messy but it's a bar so it's not a huge deal. You could get away with bringing your family on a weekday but under no circumstances would I advice a date night stop... unless you're married and date nights tend to be more on the ultra grunge side. Good food always fresh and comes from the kitchen hot!

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bruschetta Chicken Sandwich with Mac and Cheese

wxbGdcn0rwYzdIjf8aMfoA.text: Ordered for first time through Postmates and ribs and sauce were good, but Mac n cheese was dry and bland, bread was ok.  I ordered an appetizer of spinach cheese dip and chips and the chips were so thin all they did was break and could not even really eat the dip with them and the dip was too cheesy that it just tasted like strong cheese to me and bland.

H5jWCUDeZtcX3xLXjsBaYA.text: Went to DNG Friday night with a friend. Skipped the bar area in favor of the dining area so we could hear ourselves, although the bar looked fun. Had the Chicken Spiedies, sweet potato fries and a beer flight. Chicken was very tasty but could've done without the hoagie bun-it did t seem to go. My friend had the blackened fish tacos and also enjoyed them. Service was so-so-we certainly were not rushed at all.

y6HZNWslfd3p1j1TeD_ptw.text: Overall okay. Drinks are good. Food is bar food and okay. Lots of seating. Indoor and outdoor seating. Chill casual place. Lots of TVs for sports. Nothing amazing and nothing bad.

f7ZDxDXn8bLwHqHreevkUw.text: They stop serving food at midnight & we knew that. Drives across town, showed up at 11:45 and they wouldn't take us in. Change your mind if you're trying to go there for a late night bite. If you stop serving at 11:45 then maybe change your times?

7WV30HelU-SEWXrkL2aY8w.text: I have Enjoyed every experience that I have had here. Bartenders are fast and knowledgeable. They have great drink specials. The Customer friendly staff is a plus The food is above par for Bar food. The menu has various choices and the wings are Mmmm good. They have a wonderful large party space for Birthdays or a large family gathering. My friends and I have met here to watch games and enjoyed the beer buckets and had a blast!!

oV3KfsJE9wtr1drvYfb0Dw.text: I don't typically take the time to write negative reviews, but I was REALLLLY disappointed in the service I was given from Dilworth. Especially considering how much money I've spent on this restaurant in the last year. I recently bought wings from Dilworth through DoorDash (recently broke my leg and unable to drive). When the wings were received they were VERY over cooked to the point they were not edible. I'm am not writing a review because of the wings, I am writing the review due to the POOR customer service I received when reaching out to Dilworth to rectify the situation. When I reached out they told me that I would have to contact DoorDash about this issue, which made no sense because DoorDash was not the one who provided poor quality food.  But whatever, I reached out to DoorDash because the wings were truly unacceptable. When I spoke to a rep at DoorDash they stated that Dilworth would be responsible for rectifying the situation (which mAkes sense).  When I reached back out to Dilworth they refused to rectify the situation. No empathy, wouldn't even offer to make a new batch. I would have been more then happy to find a ride, return the poor quality wings to get a new batch. At this point it's simply the principle. I would never treat a customer like that. Especially a customer who literally orders from there atleast once a week. Smh. Dilworth, you need to work on your customer service. This was not a hard issue to rectify, you juSt chose not too.

fCu4rY341Q1ZdP2HZ9RQaw.text: Met here to watch a basketball tournament game a few times.  They usually have a drink special so be sure to ask.  One night, I got a Blue Moon draft for $2.50.  Another night, I got a Miller Light draft for $3.  The first night we were there, we got the salmon.  It was surprisingly good for bar food.  We really like the pretzel with beer cheese as an appetizer.  The next time we got baby back ribs.  There was a lot of meat and the BBQ sauce was good.  It came with Mac & cheese, Texas toast, and fried onions.  The onions were greasy, skip those.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/2 rack baby back ribs, Mac &amp; cheese, Texas toast, fried onions.

Xgn1-E8dtHJMMZwIBkv9Xw.text: I was there for a large lunch, so we had it catered. It was a great lunch, and other than the loud noise from the other room, it was great. The servers were attentive to our group and very helpful. I am glad we moved our monthly meeting to this location.

jlxfmAf1yAdUDGhtFhHyUQ.text: A wide menu of comfort plates and a huge tap selection make this friendly neighborhood pub just outside Uptown Charlotte a solid choice for lunch, dinner or a round of drinks after work. I love their Blackened Chicken Salad, served with a tangy and delicious Ancho Ranch dressing, and their Fish Tacos and Spiedies (grilled chicken or pork in a hoagie bun) are also excellent choices. But it's the friendly service and amazing lineup of local beers that keep me coming back. DNG has a spacious covered patio for outdoor dining or drinks, and huge event room downstairs for meetings and parties. Parking can get tight after hours, so be prepared to park offsite and walk. A local favorite.

EQs0hh_W5_io-OFr6Mt5gA.text: Wings!   This place is near my office and we drove all the way here on a Saturday for the wings! I'm not sure why they are so darn good but it's a combo of size, flavor, bite through, and well they just aren't super greasy. We were able to order two flavors and both were a win. Hot and fast these wing need are crying out for a beer.   We also had the nachos (super healthy lunch). The cheese was hot and melty and the steak was tender. The cheese sauce was mixed throughout with only a few bare chips but there was cheese elsewhere for dipping. The improvement here would be the size of the steak, they are more like a steak bite than a nacho topping. The chips held up through most of the process, as you reach the bottom naturally they are a bit soggy as expected.   This place also has a very nice area in the basement for events that shouldn't be missed as parties are planned.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chargrilled wings!
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak nachos

zoln_URO8EI9MnkFMsXfcQ.text: I stopped in here with the family a few weeks ago. We arrived on a Thursday night and surprisingly it was not very crowded. The nine of us were seated without a wait. Dilworth's menu has a lot of choices that are right up my alley but I had to try the  spiedies to see what all of the fuss was about. The food took a little long to come out, but that tends to be the case with larger parties so I can't be mad; it was tolerable. I got the grilled chicken spiedies on a hoagie roll and some added cheddar (because cheese).  For a side I opted for the mac and cheese (again, because cheese). What a solid choice. While I didn't find the chicken spiedies taste to be a unique one, it was a very tender, moist, and flavor-packed sandwich, with the chicken being the star of the show. The cheese I added was good but definitely not necessary. I see why it's served with just chicken and bread. It's because they can, lol. The bread was toasted with a nice crunch and buttery. I'm getting hungry all over again. The side of Mac and cheese was ok too. Not on the level of the spiedies but also not disappointing. I'd get both again without hesitating. Next time I'll be back for the buffalo chicken spiedies pizza. See you next time Dilworth's.

3ez_VmlJaYXQ_83RH697pA.text: Decent food and beer selection. Build your own salad is a good if expensive option. I end up here once a month, mainly because it's a meetup spot for my friends. Probably wouldn't visit it as much otherwise. Also, parking is dismal.

hXhHBTx_XY9A1H24i8r1Ew.text: I've been to DNG a few times now, and have always had good experiences.   The atmoshpere is that of a typical neighborhood sports bar. Fairly comfortable and not overly busy in terms of decor. There are two levels, so there is plenty of seating. If you are going on game day make sure you get there early, or you may have a hard time getting a good seat.  The waitstaff is friendly and attentive. Never have an issue with my glass running dry. Meals are served promptly as well.  The food is good, not terrific, but good. standard pub fare; pizza (not a fan), wings, burgers, wraps, etc...   All in all a good place to go watch a game, and have a few beers and a burger. There are better craft beer spots in Charlotte, but this place is pretty solid.

9bF1o69HSdT2YWJy8Gl5ZQ.text: This review is not so much for their food...which is good...as opposed to the amazing civic opportunities that this location provides for. Dilworth Neighborhood Grill is one of the most used locations for meetings, primarily due to the community minded attitude of their management and the extreme friendliness of their staff.   I have never been disappointed with their service or the people who work there. I highly recommend this location for any and all meetings or events you may have!

SH2_DcGRs7o1TroKeMqppQ.text: Your average bar food (wings, burgers, wraps etc.), with the addition of individual pizzas, which are pretty decent. The food isn't the reason why I'm giving DNG 5 stars. I'm a die hard NY JETS FAN, and there is a group called the Charlotte Jets Fans that meets there for every game. It's truly a dream come True for a Jet fan, and I thoroughly enjoy it! A great place to socialize with fellow Jets fans and meet people from your home town. The restaurant also makes a shot for us Jet fans called JET FUEL and it's very good!

ueQaRFzbJ6TjB74E7vmCRw.text: Dilworth Neighborhood Grille is your basic neighbood bar and grill -- hey, it's in the name!  You walk in and the bar area is upstairs, next to a long staircase leading you downstairs to a lot more seating.  It has a very clean feeling to it; nothing dirty or grungy here.  You can feel very comfortable eating here.    I've eaten here once for breakfast and countless times for dinner.  The breakfast buffet was so-so.  It was your basic scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, etc.  Nothing stood out, so I haven't been back for breakfast since.  However, for dinner (and lunches, too, but I can never make it at that time!), I was pleased to see their extensive menu.  At first glance, my eye was immediately drawn to the Chicken Spiedie Wrap and Chicken Spiedie Pizza Pie.  Why?  I hadn't heard the name Spiedie since I lived in upstate New York.  Sure enough, on the menu it reads, "Spiedies are an upstate New York Tradition."  The Spiedie sauce is basically vinegar with spices (and sold at Harris Teeter -- plug, plug!), but it's oh-so-good when you marinate chicken in it.  And it's even better when someone does it for you.  From the first moment I tried the Spiedie options at Dilworth Neighborhood Grille, I was hooked.  They are definitely worth going to DNG for and are offered at such a great value for dinner.    The service at DNG has always been spectacular, too, whether I'm upstairs at the bar or downstairs at a table.  Best of all, one of the owners has usually been there when I've been, greets me, welcomes me back, and always checks up on us to make sure everything with our meals is good.  THAT'S service with a smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. logo from website

ABSWjQy7o0v6oSmRIsg2SQ.text: This review is based off of a lunch experience only.  Meh, I've experienced better says it all.  The service was good.  The server/bartender was very friendly.  The problem was with the meal itself.    I got the crab cake sandwich with pasta salad.  I chose the crab cakes because the menu said that the crab cakes are their best appetizer.  However, I found I could not distinguish that it was actually crab meat.  The color was dark brown through out.  It appeared more like barbecue than crab meat.  I was expecting more whiteness on the inside.  On top of the bad sandwich, it was pricey.  Once I added a sweet tea and the tip, I walked away with a $15 lunch tab!  Not enough food or quality for that amount.  In general, I don't know why more places do not have a better lunch menu.  DNG's  lunch menu appears to be the same as their dinner menu.  There were no lunch time specials.

OOjkaKCEQrRTa7AzGutKNw.text: We got take-out from here and it was delicious! The spinach and artichoke dip was awesome and the chips were not your typical boring tortilla chips. We also had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and baked Spaghetti. Both were fantastic, especially the chicken!

1GEaa3_4W0Kd_0n5bKZ2lA.text: I was really, really hoping the atmosphere of this place would be a little darker and more eclectic and so was disappointed at its overly sporty vibe.  Even so, the patio is really big and nice, and they have a huge, excellent beer selection.  Also, I feel I have to mention the black bean burger.  It. Was. Awesome.

AUpaYh9QalGpxTW9b_HvTg.text: This is a great spot for drinking beer and watching the games.  Many large areas at the bar or to dine - Beer specials almost everyday.  I did not get to try the food - I will have to go back for that, but as far as meeting a large group of friends for sports and good beer - a great place to go!

Q2ugCq_FgmKO4dweeqgh8w.text: This was my first visit and I wasn't sure what to order but my waitress suggested the Blackened Chicken Tacos, I added the string onions as a side, it was incredible!  I'll definatley be back

3K9W9Y8LwoIkKljxxO95Fg.text: Could be doing more with the place.  Tons of space, great layout, really nice outdoor area.  Did not eat here so can't say yeah or nay.  Cocktails list looked like they stole it from a sorority house or a TGI Friday's.  I would not ask the staff for drink or beer recos, didn't seem too knowledgeable.  TVs everywhere so I can see it being a great place to catch college or pro football and watch several games at once.  Also, its very dude heavy.  I was with my fiancee but she was one of maybe three or four girls there with the rest of the crowd being men.  Might be one of those places the guys go to hang and drink or caught em on an off night but definitely lacking on the female patrons.

huIsfJ-nrSW7q-qfRGwYKw.text: I love this place!  The food is not amazing (it is good!), but it just feels like a "neighborhood" place (no pun intended).  Friendly staff, comfortable atmosphere, and they host the official viewing party for about 732 college and NFL games!    I would recommend trying the Black Bean Burger with homemade chips.  I am not a vegetarian, but I love it!

zgiwZv3rVjcfpY5_Z7iMsQ.text: dilworth grille is "ok" like the epitome of ok.  beware ordering a mixed drink, none of mine of have been satisfactory. food isn't bad though, nothing stellar.  the great thing about DNG is the location, the patio, and the tunes.  you would think they would be slammed on st. patty's like everywhere else, but they were uber low key, maybe 7-10 tables.

6p0yyJakpkX4P7ioX4F7qA.text: Excellent wings and atmosphere with a great sports bar setup near the stadium.   Good value and quality food. A good spot to chill.

cikAaoQab3zKXr4ytCIxyw.text: Bar food- great drink specials and nice bartenders. Haven't had a bad experience here but nothing to write home about either. Even if home is just Greensboro.

_w-AAa-ICmV4vAjyicYVow.text: Great sports bar, great brunch food on Saturdays. Good at handling large parties. Our server was a little slow, but otherwise food and drinks were delicious. Not great drink specials on Saturday afternoon, but the food made up for it.

zpozQ5V9Ow1q0ozuWOyWxw.text: Not a bad joint to grab a quick bite....very good for meetings w/ clients.  Most people don't know this, but DNG has a fantastic brunch on weekends with fabulous outdoor seating available.  The menu sure could use an upgrade; way too many wraps.  Overall not bad....not bad.....

4nydGAevif_QjB63R_RoMA.text: I met my husband here for lunch on a weekday. I brought our kids so we could all have a quick lunch with him because he had to get back to work.  Our service was super slow. Took 10 minutes to get our drinks, then another 10 minutes to order...food took 30 minutes to come out! We had 2 kids meals, a salad and a chicken pita. Waited a long time to get our check. We were there for an hour and a half...during lunch! The food was mediocre to say the least. Not somewhere we'll visit again anytime soon!

IvAhyf9fQxbXKHUw_ajxEQ.text: Nice place to have meetings and the food is o.k. Parking can be thin but if you don't mind walking a block or three you can usually find a spot. Make sure you read the signs as you will get towed. Not a bad go to place for a few drinks and a meal.

Xu3khDmOuoDEdPEOIzWnWQ.text: I like the authenticity of a good neighborhood burger bar with outdoor seating.  Nothing off the charts, but decent beers and grub in a convenient in-town location. Nothing offensive here.

Lr1B0R1mD80oAzn1LGYUAg.text: So so food and poor service made for a crummy lunch experience. Basically just so so bad food. Maybe the dinner service is good and I'm sure there is better atmosphere when a game is on. I DON'T RECOMMEND FOR LUNCH!

MXmyHUooVbAGb_fPS7Af9w.text: Food was good but service was very poor.  Server never came back after delivering food to check on our party.  Drinks were empty and when we did get to ask for more drinks it took 10 minutes to get them.  I wouldn't go there unless you have time to waste.

lydQRE_lXGhZIJaGNfXNaw.text: I've been going here on a semi-regular basis for over 12 years. The place continues to get better and better. I really enjoy watching football and other sports on their 25+ TVs. The covered patio is a great addition. The service is good and they usually have food and beer specials. The only downside is that parking can be hard to find sometimes... usually on weekends.

szWWCsaWz9hqFRH4wRTRDw.text: Worst service! Currently here still waiting for refills and napkins... oh and our server with the lime green hair... I see him through the window playing in his hair smh!

3v-xz16494ZEf__qnhDC-Q.text: Sorry guys and gals, I have read great reviews about this place, but based on my experience, I strongly disagree. Earlier this afternoon, I was invited to attend a school alumni meet. I ordered the black bean burger with sweet potato fries on the side. To my dismay, the burger had a black bean patty with just chopped lettuce and a slice of tomato. I patiently waited for my server to revisit my table, and showed him the burger and the actual fancy description on the menu. The cheese and onion, green onion as per the menu were missing. The sweet potato fries were a mixed bag, half cooked, but it was fun playing the guessing game - cooked v not cooked. Well, I thought the server would fix my sandwich, but 2 mins later, he walked in with some grated cheese and an onion ring, please see the picture attached herewith. I still tipped him, but again, I wasn't so lucky. Note to manager: need to train your staff better, mistakes happen, but don't screw up the opportunity to fix it.

u76TO5Znzvb2-OXdSWzWcQ.text: First time here. The bar manager Jessie sealed the deal. Made us excited to visit again! He told us all about the beer selections coming up and the current weekly events and specials. Our server was training another tonight and they provided memorable customer service. We had the chicken and pork spedie sandwiches with model beer drafts, which was also great. We look forward to visiting again. Staff was awesome!

Ls_27lpq7uAbhSCh853mPA.text: Absolutely love Dilworth! The food is great and the staff is even better. The atmosphere is laid back and comfortable, perfect for a date night or dinner with a bunch of friends. While their lunch / dinner food is awesome, their Sunday brunch is hard to beat; amazing variety of breakfast food and awesome lunch choices - chicken tenders, crab cakes, etc.   The outdoor area with doors that open bar to the patio really elevated the scene at Dilworth. There is a good variety of bands and fun events happening through the year.   I have also been a part of large group events held down in the lower part of the restaurant and experience the same awesome food and service. They went above and beyond to make sure the group was happy and met all the needs in a timely manner.   Good food, good service, GREAT spot!!

PWSRgCnGoHD11BO97xzJiw.text: Great food, great staff, wonderful service, and easy to get in and out. Highly recommended. Their chicken is marinated in something next to awesome!

3JpkCZZExSFMV0MeDMiTNA.text: Fun place, nice people. Great place to grab some wings and a beer. I should have known better but I tried their mother's day brunch. Shrimp were good but most everything else came out of a box. I'll definitely go back for the wings, beer, and patio. I don't recommend the brunch.

HHj7zPLUvvZqMJXT1l6Bng.text: Was very pleased with staff and service...the food was very good as well...the Nachos were out of this world

n07W-q0YALOxBVftLeX02w.text: We went during lunch & it was actually pretty empty.  The bar is a nicer area to sit in than the main dining room which looks more like a rather empty banquet area.  There are some nice large art pieces of local Charlotte scenery, but stark nonetheless.  The food was ok.  A Salmon Croquette on a bun & a Chicken Sandwich, but nothing special.  Our server was nice.  We had though about going there to watch some football games during the season & never made it in, but they don't have that many tv's (even in the bar they are smaller ones) that would make it worthwhile.  I'm glad we tried it, but I agree with others that there are better (more solid) places to visit.

IJ3U0RUnAOC6qfpIIg8WMw.text: Food was good and service was stellar. The bartender April was very attentive and fun to be around. Definitely one of the best bartenders in the industry!

fRN3zFsn5B5v9raU-1mcSA.text: We came here for a comedy show and ended up having dinner as well. Bad idea.   Taste: This is where the 2 stars came in. Food was okay. Nothing to write home about. There was a group of us. I had the Buffalo chicken sandwich and my husband had the Carne asada tacos. We also had the caprese salad and shared a basket of chicken fingers. Wasn't bad, but wasn't good.   Service: If ratings were based on service this place would not receive any stars. I have been here a few times and service has always been horrible. They are slow, forget things and not bring things. A friend ordered a sandwich and after all of us got our food we asked about the sandwich and she said she forgot to put it in.  Waited 30 minutes and had to ask multiple times for a side of Ranch for my sandwich. Asked for water refills and they never came. Have to ask multiple times for the same item. Everyone is nice and apologetic, but it's ridiculous.    Value: While this place is not expensive, what you get for what they charge varies. I felt my sandwich was fine, but my husband recieved two Carne Asada tacos for  about $9.00. These were no bigger than tacos you get at taco bell.   Overall, we would never come back, but the comedy troupe we follow performs here. But that is the ONLY reason we would return. We will be eating dinner elsewhere from now on before we go.

by3z4b20cg6QLCNlx0wJ3w.text: If you're looking for a sports bar with actually delicious food, here's your place!  Keep a look out for coupons for free appetizers!!

rKtL7vL82thM0zJZSYLZBA.text: Great atmosphere, clean, well lit, and the food!! The food is great! My wife and I had the prime rib, my kids had the pizza and chicken...it was all delicious! Waitstaff is very attentive, Menu is well thought-out, the only downside is it was quite noisy, so we could barely hear each other speak. We were in the dining area, but there was a sports game on in the bar area, and theres not much separating the 2. Other than that, no complaints. A definite must try!

MRItghJnaAkvUTGIJuATVQ.text: Always a good place to hit after a swim meet session at MCAC. So close to the pool and such good food. Buffalo blue chips app, only found here, is a great start. This visit I had the Cuban sandwhich and one of the best I've had. Certainly will be back for another. The wife had a flatbread pizza and the boy had wings. Both said they would come back for another.  Great service and good food and highly recommend.

oRSZEcVBomOhlN-GX3IgMw.text: Great spot for a group outing or a sports event. I have been to this place for the World Cup for Panthers playoff games and a few other good events. Always a good crowd good mix of people and usually have a DJ. They usually have good drink deals and a full bar with a full pub style menu I would recommend this place.

eHtdyyvd9UbKbvZ550E-Bw.text: Nicest staff in the world!! I've tried a lot of things on their awesome menu, but MY GOODNESS is their Mediterranean pizza made by GODS. BEST PIZZA HANDS DOWN IN ALL OF CHARLOTTE! Try it with Chicken :)  Can't wait to enjoy their new patio area once the warm weather comes back! Brand spankin' new bar, tons of great local beers, and great trivia nights! My go to bar here in Dilworth :)

7kG3qbrhEoqMYAsOJbXKcQ.text: Food was good.  Great place to watch the games.  Bartenders were super nice, Eli introduced himself and was very friendly.  Plenty of good beers on tap.  Just an all around great neighborhood bar.  And the new patio is great!

-8z0Y3TSapRv5loFr8EPvQ.text: This is maybe a not so hidden gem? I like the open bar area that flows out to patio area. The food is generous and pretty darn good. My favorites include wing and chicken quesadillas - the quesadillas are so good honestly  the best that I've had-stuffed so well and have such good flavor(mildly spicy) filled oozing with good cheese but not soggy- rather the perfect amount of toasting. The sweet potato Fries are good too. A lot of beers. Female bartenders are friendly enough. Male bartenders- eh. Nice to relax there

Sd2wT7_Ijhi_b17S7mCA6Q.text: Love dilworth!  I live right down the street so I'm there a lot.  The food is good and the bartenders are great!  I never have a bad time.

ydLmxVolX5fO68-Cx8vUvA.text: Excellent location for a group brunch at a very reasonable price! The server was patient with our large party of 30, however the buffet food was never consistent. Each time I came back to the buffet the food looked and tasted slightly different. This hit or miss aspect of the buffet is the only reason why they have 4 stars and not 5.

asNsX4GqXxAa8lRXbZ545w.text: The staff here is so accommodating. They made sure everything was just as I had desired. Can't say enough about Josh and Curtis being attentive and friendly. The meal I ordered was cooked to perfection.

nah46Jhh8W-7sSQaWuaisA.text: I ended up here for MNF. My first time here, nice establishment. The bar staff was very nice and were always asking if I wanted anything and if everything was ok. I ordered two drinks (very reasonably priced) and the steakhouse pub nachos. They were yummy, presentation was wonderful. My only problem with the nachos is there was not enough meat. I would order again since this is the meet-up spot but I would request extra steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steakhouse Pub Nachos

jvwP9Ec9ERqKTXIFskB5eQ.text: I absolutely love Dilworth Grille! The Buffalo Bule chips for an appetizer are amazing and I get the Blackened Fish Tacos every single time I am I am here!  The bar always has a fun crowd when we dine in...but there great for take out too!

_tAiYx3g3thkgmt7Nra84Q.text: The food has here has always been great and the number of TVs plus some big projector screens has always made it a great place to watch a game. Many alumni groups use this as their gathering place on game days including the University of Tennessee. I am a huge fan of the Chicken Spedie Pie (pizza) and the Black Bean Burger. They also have a delicious pizza fritters dessert and pretty good wings. The new patio is amazing and will make this an even better place to gather and watch game. While thei parking lot is not huge, there are several areas nearby to park. I wish they were a little more clear and comforting on their website though on where you might and might not get towed. The only reason this isn't a 5-star for me is that the service is pretty spotty. Most of the time it's okay but I've been a few times where it has been downright awful including twice where they forgot to put my order in during game.

GZuycsxIn-Gmd-LMElsVIg.text: Dilworth Neighborhood Grille has really stepped up their game with their expanded patio and outdoor bar. Dilworth has always been a favorite happy hour spot for my coworkers because it is close to Uptown and has parking.   When I lived in Dilworth, Dilworth Neighborhood Grille was basically an extension of my house because it's convenient, fast, affordable, open late, and has some delicious pub grub.  Service is typically on the slow side, so don't go in a hurry. The only other negative is that their beer list is, in my humble opinion, lacking. They have a surprisingly small list of local beers on tap, which is kind of a bummer!

vhLPcydPJ7EsXhc0Mbeaww.text: Ordered ribs from DG tonight for dinner.  The ribs were probably amongst the worst I've ever had.  Not tender at all, not flavorful at all, hardly any sauce on them and almost appeared slightly undercooked.  Took 2 bites and threw my entire order in the trash. I would've sent my entree back to the kitchen, but it was a to go order unfortunately.    Signed,  Deeply dissatisfied, still hungry, and out $15.

ritwbMX8C63BWsfhzclh-A.text: I have been to Dilworth Grille many times. Recently I was there for the Carolina Duke game. The UNC Alumni org and the place was full of Tarheel spirit. The downstairs was the perfect place ti watch the game with several projectors and tvs. They had great drink specials and the staff was great even with the large crowd. This place is perfect for large group events.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina game

Kp_ZLH16AoqNnuAWhAVseg.text: I've been to Dilworth Neighborhood Grille a few times before but it was before my Yelping days.  Yesterday I was able to go back and sit at the bar.  Although I really enjoyed my bar experience, this review is about the food.  I remember the food being better than this.  They used to serve brunch here and they were amazing. I don't think they do that anymore.  Today I had a Blackened Tuna wrap which was listed as a "Dilworth Favorite" and fries.  Let me say this...The fries were the absolute worst I've ever tasted, even worse than some fast food places.  There was no flavor and not even 2lbs of salt and being smothered in ketchup could save them.  And on the tuna wrap, the only flavor I got was from the sauce.  There wasn't much blackened flavor at all.  What saved this from being a one-star review is that even though the bar was busy, the bartenders were very friendly and helpful, especially Kelsey.    Sorry DNG, I really thought your food was better.

q9nMRJKFYsCIXPZsFqOsug.text: I want to like this place. It has such a prime location (walkable from my house) that it will always do well especially during football season. But, the service here is atrocious. I waited until my third trip to give a review. The place was 30% full and it still took 15 minutes before we even had someone ask for our drinks. We ordered apps, beers, and waters right away just because we knew the service was slow. We got the beers 10 minutes later, waters nowhere to be seen(we eventually walked to the bar to get them ourselves) and the food took 30 minutes to come out (wings and bruschetta). I won't comment on the food because it was passable. But again, when the food came out we didn't get plates. Okay, whatever. The waiter kept passing by, never once asked how it was, do we want another drink, etc... I'm seriously not one to complain but fuck, ask if we want to spend money on a drink. Jesus.  Then, getting a check was impossible. Again, we grabbed another waiter to get that for us. I took pictures of the staff (stripped sleeves on shirt) because they all sat eating and drinking with other people instead of working. Even if they were off, take your work shirt off.   Bottom line, this place will do fine because of location. The service is fucking miserable.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Empty bar and still shit service
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drinking and eating while we wait for service
Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. None of them work, they sit and drink with everyone

Vd1zWaX_mBrv5C7QgqADHA.text: Great during the week for a quick business lunch. My favorites are the Greek chicken pita and sweet potato fries.  AMAZING on Sunday for Southern buffet brunch! It has everything from chicken nuggets and cheese grits to eggs Benedict and mac & cheese. And all for the bargain price of $18/pp! Best deal in town!

Untmr7VcUSkHre8ONk0PUw.text: I just visited Dilworth Bar & Grille to partake in the Charlotte Burger Week.  When arriving, our server informed us that her manager was stating that the promotion didn't start until the following day.  After pointing out that the poster they had hanging on the wall showed the promotion started today.. She went back and checked with her manager. He was still holding firm they wouldn't honor the promotion.  We had  already ordered beers and ended op staying and eating, Food was fine,  but will not return.  I was shocked at the poor customer service from the manager. Who does that?!

JE-HYbMxlwp9aCKavXIjpQ.text: Went on a Tuesday night for trivia and had some beers and food to go. We are horrible at trivia but had fun doing something different for a change. Crowd was mixed and place wasn't too packed. Got the Berkeley salad with blackened salmon and ribs to go. Both were delicious and would order again. Our waitress was friendly and checked on us frequently. This is a standard bar/pub and would go back again.

NhtMxw4PCVVhYeIFIr53-Q.text: Awesome. Food was good, prices were good, service was good, you get what you pay for. This is a great local places for around for a long time that you should not forget about.

mK6QP3fGo80_lRW2qOdXjg.text: Not consistent.  I work at the hospital and have tried to get take-out on several occasions from here. I always order well done burgers and for the second time in a row I get home to find it raw on the inside.  If you cannot cook a simple burger I have serious reservations about your kitchen.  Such a shame.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States

CYqJKqwavinmLmZ49rBW4Q.text: I like this spot, it's decently priced but more so, they have an awesome beer selection and I believe $2 Miller Lite bottles every day.   I've never been disappointed with the food or service and have tried their black bean burger and most recently, the Chicken Spiedie Pizza which was out of this world!! I don't know what the Spiedie sauce is but I want to make love to it.  Great wait staff and bartenders and many tv's for football season, we like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Dilworth Neighborhood Grille - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Spiedie Pizza. I carried out but got a little too distracted with their beer list so that&#39;s the reason it looks so dry

UzDjHOQoP9Bf5J_823XleQ.text: This place is great! Delicious food- some of the best fries I have had. Good times, great service. Our server, Amber was excellent. The bartender was great too, but their beer specials were a little confusing. That is the only reason I am giving 4stars instead of 5.

IbLL4vaEvftT2pov1W4DJQ.text: update: total improvement to Sunday brunch. chicken bites and  crab cakes were perfectly cooked. (not burnt). shrimp and salmon very fresh. great job!
